Psalms 25:18 Look upon my lowliness and my toil, and forgive all my sins.
Psalms 25:19 Look at my enemies, for they have multiplied, and they hate me with an unjust hatred.
Psalms 25:20 Protect my life and rescue me. I will not be put to shame, for I have placed my hope in You.
Psalms 25:21 Let innocence and uprightness preserve me, because I have waited patiently for You, my Lord.
Psalms 25:22 O God, deliver the people of Israel from all their troubles.
Psalms 26:1 The Lord is the source of my understanding, and He is my salvation—so whom shall I fear? The Lord is the protector of my entire life—so before whom shall I tremble?
Psalms 26:2 When evil people approached to utterly destroy me, my very enemies who troubled me were themselves weakened and fell down.
Psalms 26:3 If an entire army camps against me, my heart will not be afraid. If a battle rises up against me, even in this situation, I will place my hope in God.
Psalms 26:4 I have asked one thing from the Lord, and this I will diligently seek: that I may dwell in the presence of the Lord all the days of my life, that I may perceive the will of the Lord, and that I may seek Him in His holy temple.
Psalms 26:5 For He will conceal me within His sacred dwelling. In the day of evils, He will protect me in the secret place of His tent. He will lift me high upon a secure rock.
Psalms 26:6 And now, He has raised my head above my enemies, granting me victory. I have walked around His dwelling, and I have offered in His tent a sacrifice of exultation and joy. I will sing and give praise to the Lord.
Psalms 26:7 Hear, O Lord, my voice with which I have cried out to You. Show me Your mercy, and hear my prayer.
Psalms 26:8 My heart has said to You, 'My whole being has sought You.' Your face, O Lord, I will continually seek.
Psalms 26:9 Do not turn Your face away from me. Do not, in Your anger, turn away from Your servant. Be my helper; do not abandon me, nor despise me, O God, my Savior.
Psalms 26:10 Even if my father and my mother were to abandon me, the Lord would nonetheless take me up and care for me.
Psalms 26:11 Teach me Your way, O Lord. Guide me along a straight path because of my enemies, so I do not falter.
Psalms 26:12 Do not deliver me over to the malicious desires of those who trouble me. For unjust witnesses have risen up against me, and their wickedness has proven to be a lie against itself.
Psalms 26:13 I am confident that I shall see the good things of the Lord while I am still in the land of the living—that is, in this earthly life.
Psalms 26:14 Wait for the Lord; be courageous, and let your heart be strengthened. Yes, continue to wait for the Lord.
Psalms 27:1 From David. The Lord is my light, illuminating my path and my salvation; whom should I fear? The Lord protects my life; whom should I dread or be afraid of?
Psalms 27:2 When evil people came against me, intent on destroying me, my enemies who troubled me, they stumbled and fell. They grew weak and collapsed.
Psalms 27:3 Even if an army sets up camp against me, my heart will not be afraid. Even if a war breaks out against me, I will still hope in the Lord and trust Him.
Psalms 27:4 I have asked the Lord for one thing, and this is what I will always seek: to live in the presence of the Lord all the days of my life. This is so I may contemplate the beauty of the Lord and always be near His holy temple.
Psalms 27:5 Because in times of trouble, He will hide me in His sacred dwelling place, His tabernacle. He will protect me in the secret depths of His presence.
Psalms 27:6 He has set me high upon a solid rock. And now, He has raised my head above all my enemies, giving me victory and honor.
Psalms 27:7 I will circle His tabernacle in joyful procession, and there I will offer a sacrifice of praise with shouts of joy. I will sing and make music to the Lord, giving Him honor.
Psalms 27:8 Hear my voice, O Lord, when I call out to You in prayer. Have mercy on me, and listen to my pleas.
Psalms 27:9 My heart spoke to You, saying, 'My entire being seeks You out.' I will diligently seek Your presence, O Lord.
Psalms 27:10 Do not turn Your face away from me, and do not reject Your servant in anger. Be my helper. Do not abandon me, nor look down upon me, O God, my Savior and the source of my salvation.
Psalms 27:11 Even if my father and my mother were to abandon me, the Lord Himself would take me in and care for me.
Psalms 27:12 Teach me Your way, O Lord. Guide me on a straight and righteous path because of those who watch to harm me.
Psalms 27:13 Do not give me over to the malicious desires of those who trouble me. For false witnesses have risen up against me, and their wickedness has proven itself to be a lie.
Psalms 27:14 I firmly believe that I will see the goodness of the Lord here, in this life, in the land of the living.
Psalms 27:15 Wait patiently for the Lord to act. Be strong and courageous, and let your heart take courage. Yes, wait patiently for the Lord.
Psalms 28:1 A Psalm of David. Offer to the Lord, you divine beings. Offer to the Lord, you mighty ones. Offer to the Lord His glory and honor.
Psalms 28:2 Offer to the Lord glory in His name. Worship the Lord in His sacred court.
Psalms 28:3 The voice of the Lord echoes over the waters. The God of Majesty has thundered. The Lord rules over all the mighty waters.
Psalms 28:4 The voice of the Lord is filled with power. The voice of the Lord is majestic.
Psalms 28:5 The voice of the Lord shatters the cedar trees. The Lord shatters the cedars of Lebanon.
Psalms 28:6 He makes them, the cedars, leap like a calf from Lebanon. And He makes His beloved land leap like a young wild ox.
Psalms 28:7 The voice of the Lord strikes forth flashes of fire.
Psalms 28:8 The voice of the Lord shakes the desert. The Lord makes the desert of Kadesh tremble.
Psalms 28:9 The voice of the Lord causes the deer to give birth, and strips bare the forests. In His sacred temple, everyone will declare His glory.
Psalms 28:10 The Lord presides over the floodwaters. And the Lord will reign as king forever.
Psalms 28:11 The Lord will give strength to His people. The Lord will bless His people with peace.
Psalms 29:1 Offer to the Lord, O celestial beings; offer to the Lord, O powerful ones, your strength.
Psalms 29:2 Offer to the Lord glory and honor; offer to the Lord the glory of His name. Worship the Lord in His holy court.
Psalms 29:3 The voice of the Lord is over the vast waters; the God of majesty has thundered; the Lord is enthroned over the mighty waters.
Psalms 29:4 The voice of the Lord is full of power; the voice of the Lord is full of majesty.
Psalms 29:5 The voice of the Lord breaks apart the cedars; indeed, the Lord breaks the cedars of Lebanon.
Psalms 29:6 He makes them leap like a young bull of Lebanon, and the beloved land itself skips like a young wild ox.
Psalms 29:7 The voice of the Lord strikes forth bolts of lightning.
Psalms 29:8 The voice of the Lord shakes the desert; the Lord causes the desert of Kadesh to tremble.
Psalms 29:9 The voice of the Lord makes the hinds give birth prematurely, and strips bare the dense forests. And in His temple, everyone will proclaim His glory.
Psalms 29:10 The Lord presided over the great flood; and the Lord will reign as King forever.
Psalms 29:11 The Lord will give strength to His people; the Lord will bless His people with true peace.
Psalms 30:1 For the end. A Psalm of David.
Psalms 30:2 In You, O Lord, I have placed my hope. I will never be confounded or disgraced. By Your justice, set me free.
Psalms 30:3 Listen closely to me, incline Your ear. Hurry to rescue me. Be my protecting God, my safe home, to deliver me.
Psalms 30:4 For You are my strength and my safe place. And for the glory of Your Name, You will lead me and provide for me.
Psalms 30:5 You will pull me out of this hidden trap that they set for me, for You are my guardian.
Psalms 30:6 Into Your hands I entrust my very life. You have saved me, O Lord, God who is truth itself.
Psalms 30:7 You despise those who foolishly worship worthless things.
Psalms 30:8 But I, for my part, have put my trust in the Lord.
Psalms 30:9 I will rejoice and be glad in Your mercy. For You have seen my lowliness, You have delivered my life from desperate distress.
Psalms 30:10 You did not let my enemies trap me. You have given me freedom and a safe place to stand.
Psalms 30:11 Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am in distress. My sight is dim from grief, my soul is consumed by sorrow, and my very body wastes away.
Psalms 30:12 My life is spent in misery, my years consumed by groans. My strength fails because of my affliction, and my bones are wasting away.
Psalms 30:13 Because of all my enemies, I am mocked and shamed. Even my neighbors and my friends are now afraid of me. Everyone who sees me on the street runs away.
Psalms 30:14 I am forgotten, as if I were dead and gone from their memory. I am like a broken, useless pot.
Psalms 30:15 I hear the slanders of many who gather around me. As they conspire against me together, they plan to take my life.
Psalms 30:16 But I, for my part, have trusted in You, O Lord. I declare: 'You are my God!'
Psalms 30:17 My destiny is in Your hands. Rescue me from the power of my enemies and from those who pursue me.
Psalms 30:18 Let Your face shine with favor upon Your servant. Save me because of Your steadfast love.
Psalms 30:19 O Lord, I will not be put to shame, for I have called upon Your name. Let the wicked be disgraced and cast down into the realm of the dead.
Psalms 30:20 Let their lying lips be silenced, those who speak evil against the righteous with arrogance and contempt.
Psalms 30:21 How immense is Your goodness, O Lord! You store it up for those who reverence You. You lavish it upon those who trust in You, for all people to see.
Psalms 30:22 You keep them safe in Your presence, away from human plotting. You shield them in Your sanctuary from slanderous words.
Psalms 30:23 Blessed be the Lord, for He has wondrously shown His faithful love to me as if in a strong, safe city.
Psalms 30:24 But I, in my panic and despair, thought: 'I am utterly cut off from Your sight.' Yet You heard my plea when I cried out to You.
Psalms 30:25 Love the Lord, all His holy ones! For the Lord preserves the faithful, but harshly punishes those who act with arrogance.
Psalms 30:26 Be strong and courageous, and let your hearts be strengthened, all of you who place your hope in the Lord.
Psalms 31:1 Blessed are those whose wicked deeds have been forgiven, and whose personal sins have been completely covered by God's mercy.
Psalms 31:2 Blessed is the person to whom the Lord does not hold their sin against them, and in whose spirit there is no deceit, no hidden guilt.
Psalms 31:3 For when I kept silent about my sin and would not confess it, my strength wasted away. My very bones grew weak as I groaned and cried out all day long.
Psalms 31:4 For day and night, Your heavy hand of correction was upon me. I was completely exhausted and overwhelmed, like one pierced by a thorn, in my deep distress.
Psalms 31:5 I made my transgression known to You. And I did not hide my wrongdoing. I said to myself, "I will confess my wrongdoing against myself to the Lord." And You, O Lord, then forgave the wickedness of my sin.
Psalms 31:6 For this reason, every faithful one will pray to You at the proper time of their need. Surely, even when great floods of overwhelming troubles come upon them, these troubles will not come near or overwhelm the faithful.
Psalms 31:7 You are my safe refuge from the troubles that surround me. You are my joy and my song of triumph. Deliver me from those who would entrap me.
Psalms 31:8 I will give you understanding and insight, says the Lord. And I will teach you the way you should walk. My eyes will be firmly fixed on you, guiding and watching over you.
Psalms 31:9 Do not be like a horse or a mule, which have no understanding. Their mouths must be restrained with a bit and a bridle; otherwise, they will not come near to you, they will stray.
Psalms 31:10 Many are the scourges and punishments for the wicked who refuse God. But mercy will surround those who put their hope and trust in the Lord.
Psalms 31:11 Rejoice in the Lord! And exult with joy, you righteous ones! And glory in Him, all you who are upright in heart!
Psalms 32:1 Rejoice and be joyful, you who are righteous, in the Lord; praise is fitting for those whose hearts are pure.
Psalms 32:2 Give thanks to the Lord with a lyre; sing praises to Him with a ten-stringed harp.
Psalms 32:3 Sing a new song to Him; make music skillfully to Him with loud shouts of joy.
Psalms 32:4 For the word of the Lord is right and true, and all of His works are done in faithfulness and truth.
Psalms 32:5 The Lord loves mercy and justice; the earth is full of the Lord's merciful love.
Psalms 32:6 By the word of the Lord, the universe was made firm, and by the breath of His mouth, all its power and forces came into being.
Psalms 32:7 He gathers the waters of the sea as if into a waterskin; He places the deep oceans into His storehouses.
Psalms 32:8 Let all the earth fear the Lord; let all who inhabit the world stand in awe and reverence of Him.
Psalms 32:9 For He spoke, and it came into being; He commanded, and it was created.
Psalms 32:10 The Lord brings to nothing the plans of the nations; He frustrates the intentions of the peoples, and He rejects the schemes of rulers.
Psalms 32:11 But the plan of the Lord stands firm forever; the intentions of His heart endure from generation to generation.
Psalms 32:12 Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord; blessed are the people He has chosen for His own inheritance.
Psalms 32:13 From the created sky, the Lord looked down; He saw all the children of humankind.
Psalms 32:14 From His prepared dwelling, He looked down upon all those who inhabit the earth.
Psalms 32:15 He who formed each of their hearts individually; He who understands all of their works.
Psalms 32:16 A king is not saved by a great army; nor is a warrior rescued by his great strength.
Psalms 32:17 A war-horse is a deceptive means of salvation; nor will it deliver anyone by its abundant power.
Psalms 32:18 Behold, the eyes of the Lord are upon those who fear Him; and upon those who hope in His merciful love.
Psalms 32:19 He watches over them to deliver their souls from death; and to keep them alive during times of famine.
Psalms 32:20 Our soul waits patiently for the Lord; for He is our helper and our protector.
Psalms 32:21 For in Him our heart will rejoice; and in His holy name we will place our hope.
Psalms 32:22 Let Your merciful love, O Lord, be upon us; just as we have hoped in You.
Psalms 33:1 Rejoice in the Lord, you who are righteous; praise is fitting for those whose hearts are upright.
Psalms 33:2 Give thanks to the Lord with the zither; sing to Him with a ten-stringed psaltery.
Psalms 33:3 Sing to Him a new song; play skillfully and shout for joy to Him.
Psalms 33:4 Because the word of the Lord is right and true, and all His works are done with faithfulness.
Psalms 33:5 He loves mercy and justice; the whole earth is filled with the Lord's mercy and unfailing love.
Psalms 33:6 By the word of the Lord, the universe was established, and by the breath of His mouth, all its power came into being.
Psalms 33:7 He gathered the waters of the sea like a wineskin, storing the deep waters in His hidden treasuries.
Psalms 33:8 Let all the earth fear the Lord; let all who live in the world tremble before Him.
Psalms 33:9 For He spoke, and it came to be; He commanded, and it was created and stood firm.
Psalms 33:10 The Lord frustrates the plans of the nations; He thwarts the schemes of the peoples and rejects the counsels of their leaders.
Psalms 33:11 But the Lord's plan stands forever; the intentions of His heart endure from generation to generation.
Psalms 33:12 Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord; blessed are the people He has chosen as His own inheritance.
Psalms 33:13 From the universe, the Lord looked down; He saw all the children of mankind.
Psalms 33:14 From His established dwelling place, He looked upon all who live on the earth.
Psalms 33:15 He who formed each of their hearts individually; He who understands all their works and actions.
Psalms 33:16 A king is not saved by his great army, nor is a warrior rescued by his vast strength.
Psalms 33:17 A warhorse is a deceitful hope for victory; despite its great power, it cannot deliver salvation.
Psalms 33:18 Behold, the eyes of the Lord are upon those who fear Him; upon those who hope in His mercy.
Psalms 33:19 He watches over them to rescue their souls from death and to sustain them during famine.
Psalms 33:20 Our soul waits patiently for the Lord, for He is our helper and our shield.
Psalms 33:21 Because in Him our heart will rejoice, and we have trusted in His holy Name.
Psalms 33:22 Let Your mercy, O Lord, be upon us, just as we have hoped in You.
Psalms 34:1 This is a psalm of David. He wrote it when he pretended to be insane in front of King Abimelech, who then sent him away.
Psalms 34:2 I will give thanks to the Lord at all times and in every circumstance; His praise will always be upon my lips.
Psalms 34:3 My soul will praise the Lord, finding its glory in Him. Let all those who are humble and gentle hear this, and let them rejoice.
Psalms 34:4 Join with me in praising the Lord; let us together lift up His holy name.
Psalms 34:5 I sought the Lord in my distress, and He heard my prayer; He rescued me from every single one of my troubles.
Psalms 34:6 Come close to God, and He will give you light and understanding; then you will not be ashamed or disappointed.
Psalms 34:7 This poor man cried out to God for help, and the Lord heard him; He saved him from all of his afflictions.
Psalms 34:8 The angel of the Lord camps around those who revere Him, protecting them; and He rescues them from danger.
Psalms 34:9 Experience for yourselves and see how good the Lord is; blessed is the man who trusts in Him.
Psalms 34:10 Respect and revere the Lord, all you His holy ones, because those who truly fear Him lack nothing good.
Psalms 34:11 Even the wealthy often suffer want and hunger; but those who diligently seek the Lord will never lack any good thing.
Psalms 34:12 Come, my children, and listen to me; I will teach you what it means to truly revere the Lord.
Psalms 34:13 Who is the man who desires true life, and longs to see many good days?
Psalms 34:14 Keep your tongue from speaking evil, and your lips from uttering deceitful words.
Psalms 34:15 Turn away from doing evil, and instead do what is good; seek peace actively, and follow after it.
Psalms 34:16 The Lord's gaze is upon those who are righteous, and His ears are open to their prayers.
Psalms 34:17 But the Lord is set against those who do evil, intending to erase their memory from the face of the earth.
Psalms 34:18 When the righteous cry out to Him, the Lord hears them; and He delivers them from all their troubles.
Psalms 34:19 The Lord is close to those whose hearts are broken and contrite; He saves those who are humble in spirit.
Psalms 34:20 The righteous will experience many hardships; yet, from all these, the Lord will deliver them.
Psalms 34:21 The Lord protects every part of their being, down to their very bones; not one of them will be broken.
Psalms 34:22 The death of sinners is a terrible end; and those who hate the righteous will be punished for their offenses.
Psalms 34:23 The Lord will redeem the souls of His servants; and none of those who place their hope in Him will be condemned or found guilty.
Psalms 35:1 For the end. A Psalm of David. Judge, Lord, those who would harm me; fight those who attack me.
Psalms 35:2 Pick up your weapons and your shield, and come to help me!
Psalms 35:3 Draw your sword, and close in on those who are chasing me. Say to my soul, “I am your salvation!”
Psalms 35:4 Let those who seek to destroy my life be shamed and disgraced. Let those who plot evil against me be turned back and confused.
Psalms 35:5 Let them become like dust before the wind, and let the angel of the Lord oppress them.
Psalms 35:6 Let their path be dark and slippery, and let the angel of the Lord pursue them.
Psalms 35:7 For they have hidden the pitfall of their net for me without cause, and they have attacked my soul without cause.
Psalms 35:8 Let destruction come upon him unexpectedly; let the trap he set catch him, and let him fall into it.
Psalms 35:9 Then my soul will rejoice in the Lord, and delight in His salvation.
Psalms 35:10 All my bones will say, “Lord, who is like you?” You rescue the poor from the hands of the strong, and the needy from those who would plunder them.
Psalms 35:11 Those who accuse me falsely rise up; they question me about things I do not know.
Psalms 35:12 They repay me evil for good, and cause me to suffer. 
Psalms 35:13 But as for me, when they were attacking me, I put on sackcloth,
Psalms 35:14 I humbled my soul with fasting, and my prayer will be returned to my own heart.
Psalms 35:15 I acted as if they were my neighbor and brother; I mourned as if I was grieving and humbled.
Psalms 35:16 But they rejoiced against me and gathered together; they gathered against me to bring trouble, and I did not know it.
Psalms 35:17 They were scattered, they did not relent; they gnashed their teeth against me.
Psalms 35:18 Lord, when will you look? Rescue my soul from their wickedness, from these lions, my life.
Psalms 35:19 I will give thanks to you in the great assembly; I will praise you among the great people.
Psalms 35:20 Let not those who are wrongly attacking me rejoice over me; they hate me without cause, and they wink their eyes.
Psalms 35:21 For they do not speak of peace to me, but they speak of treachery, devising deceit in their hearts.
Psalms 35:22 They said, “Aha, aha, our eyes have seen what we wanted!
Psalms 35:23 You have seen this, Lord, do not be silent; Lord, do not withdraw from me!
Psalms 35:24 Arise and awake for my vindication, for my cause, O my God and my Lord.
Psalms 35:25 Judge me according to your righteousness, O Lord my God, and let them not rejoice over me.
Psalms 35:26 Do not let them say in their hearts, “Aha, our hearts’ desire!” Nor let them say, “We have swallowed him up.”
Psalms 35:27 Let those who rejoice at my misfortune be ashamed and disgraced; let those who boast against me be clothed with shame and dishonor.
Psalms 35:28 Let those who desire my vindication shout for joy and be glad; and let them say continually, “The Lord be magnified, who delights in the peace of His servant.”
Psalms 35:29 And my tongue will meditate on your righteousness and your praise all day long.
Psalms 36:1 How long, O Lord, will you completely forget me? How long will you turn your face away from me?
Psalms 36:2 How long will I be forced to consider my anguish in my soul, and my pain in my heart every day?
Psalms 36:3 How long will my enemy have power over me? Consider this, and hear me, O Lord my God.
Psalms 36:4 Enlighten my eyes. Do not ever let me sleep the sleep of death. Otherwise, my enemy will be able to say, 'I have prevailed against him.'
Psalms 36:5 Those who afflict me will rejoice if I am moved and fall. But I have put my hope in your mercy.
Psalms 36:6 My heart will rejoice at your salvation. I will sing to the Lord, because He has given me good things.
Psalms 36:7 The Lord will reward me according to my righteousness, and according to the purity of my hands in his sight.
Psalms 36:8 Because I have kept the ways of the Lord, and I have not acted wickedly against my God.
Psalms 36:9 Because all his judgments are before me; and I have not rejected his justifications.
Psalms 36:10 And I will be blameless with Him; and I will keep myself from sin.
Psalms 36:11 And the Lord will reward me according to my righteousness, and according to the purity of my hands in his sight.
Psalms 36:12 You will be holy with the holy, and innocent with the innocent man.
Psalms 36:13 And you will be chosen with the chosen, and with the perverse, you will be perverse.
Psalms 36:14 For you will save a humble people, and you will bring down the eyes of the proud.
Psalms 36:15 For you will light my lamp, O Lord my God; illuminate my darkness.
Psalms 36:16 For I will be rescued from the temptation in you, and in my God I will cross over the wall.
Psalms 36:17 God's way is immaculate. The words of the Lord are tested by fire; He is the protector of all who hope in Him.
Psalms 36:18 Who is God besides the Lord? Or who is God except our God?
Psalms 36:19 God, who has armed me with virtue, and has made my way immaculate.
Psalms 36:20 Who has made my feet like the feet of the deer, and has established me on high places.
Psalms 36:21 Who teaches my hands for battle, and you have made my arms like a bronze bow.
Psalms 36:22 And you have given me the protection of your salvation; and your right hand has sustained me. Your discipline has corrected me to the end; and your discipline has taught me.
Psalms 36:23 You have enlarged my steps beneath me, and my footsteps have not weakened.
Psalms 36:24 I will pursue my enemies and I will comprehend them; and I will not turn back until they are finished.
Psalms 36:25 I will shatter them, and they will not be able to stand; they will fall beneath my feet.
Psalms 36:26 And you have girded me with virtue for battle; and you have made those who rise against me to stumble.
Psalms 36:27 And you have given my enemies their backs to me, and you have destroyed those who hate me.
Psalms 36:28 They cried out, and there was no one to save them; to the Lord, and he did not hear them.
Psalms 36:29 And I will crush them like dust before the face of the wind. I will trample them like the mud of the streets.
Psalms 36:30 You will rescue me from the contradictions of the people; you will establish me as the head of the Gentiles.
Psalms 36:31 A people I do not know has served me; at the hearing of the ear, they have obeyed me.
Psalms 36:32 Foreign children have lied to me; foreign children have grown old, and they have faltered from their paths.
Psalms 36:33 The Lord lives, and blessed is my God, and let the God of my salvation be exalted.
Psalms 36:34 God, who gives me vengeance, and subjects the peoples under me.
Psalms 36:35 My liberator from my wrathful enemies. You will exalt me from those who rise up against me; you will rescue me from the wicked man.
Psalms 36:36 Therefore, I will confess to you among the Gentiles, O Lord; and I will sing a psalm to your name.
Psalms 36:37 Magnifying the saving acts of his King, and showing mercy to his Christ, David, and to his seed forever.
Psalms 37:1 Don't be jealous of evildoers or those who make a habit of doing what is evil.
Psalms 37:2 Their success is brief like grass—it quickly dries up. They are like all those plants that quickly die.
Psalms 37:3 Trust in the Lord and be good; remain on the land, and He will nourish your soul.
Psalms 37:4 Find joy in the Lord, and He will grant what you ask for.
Psalms 37:5 Entrust your way to the Lord; trust in Him, and He will act.
Psalms 37:6 He will cause your justice to shine like light and your judgment like the midday sun.
Psalms 37:7 Submit to the Lord and pray to Him. Don't be jealous of those who succeed through their own means or of people who do wrong.
Psalms 37:8 Refrain from anger, and abandon fury; don't be jealous and resort to evil.
Psalms 37:9 Because those who do evil will be destroyed, but those who trust in the Lord will inherit the land.
Psalms 37:10 Yet a little while, and the sinner will be no more; you will search for him, but you will not find him.
Psalms 37:11 But the meek will inherit the land and will delight in the abundance of peace.
Psalms 37:12 The sinner plots against the righteous and gnashes his teeth at him.
Psalms 37:13 But the Lord will laugh at him because He sees that his day is coming.
Psalms 37:14 The sinners have drawn their sword and bent their bow to strike the poor and needy, to slaughter the upright of heart.
Psalms 37:15 Let their sword enter their own hearts, and let their bow be broken.
Psalms 37:16 Better is a little that the righteous has than the great wealth of the wicked.
Psalms 37:17 Because the arms of the sinners will be broken, but the Lord upholds the righteous.
Psalms 37:18 The Lord knows the days of the blameless, and their inheritance will be eternal.
Psalms 37:19 They will not be ashamed in the time of evil, and in the days of famine they will be satisfied; because the wicked will be consumed.
Psalms 37:20 For the enemies of the Lord, though they may be honored and exalted, will vanish like smoke.
Psalms 37:21 The sinner borrows but does not pay back, but the righteous shows mercy and gives.
Psalms 37:22 For those whom He blesses will inherit the land, but those whom He curses will perish.
Psalms 37:23 The steps of a man are directed by the Lord, and when He desires his way, He makes it wide.
Psalms 37:24 Though he falls, he will not be crushed, because the Lord sustains him with His hand.
Psalms 37:25 I was young and now I am old, and I have not seen the righteous forsaken or his children begging for bread.
Psalms 37:26 All day long, the righteous shows mercy and lends, and his seed will be a blessing.
Psalms 37:27 Turn away from evil and do good, and remain forever.
Psalms 37:28 Because the Lord loves justice and will not forsake His saints; they will be preserved forever.
Psalms 37:29 The wicked will be punished, and the seed of the impious will perish.
Psalms 37:30 But the righteous will inherit the land and will dwell on it forever.
Psalms 37:31 The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, and his tongue speaks of justice.
Psalms 37:32 The law of his God is in his heart, and his steps will not be tripped up.
Psalms 37:33 The sinner watches the righteous and seeks to kill him.
Psalms 37:34 But the Lord will not leave him in his hands nor condemn him when he is judged.
Psalms 37:35 Wait for the Lord and keep His way, and He will exalt you to inherit the land; you will see when the sinners are destroyed.
Psalms 37:36 I have seen the wicked exalted and lifted up like the cedars of Lebanon.
Psalms 37:37 Then I passed by, and behold, he was gone; I searched for him, but his place could not be found.
Psalms 37:38 Guard innocence and look to integrity, because there is a future for the man of peace.
Psalms 37:39 But the wicked will perish together, and the future of the impious will be destroyed.
Psalms 37:40 But the salvation of the righteous comes from the Lord, and He is their protector in the time of tribulation.
Psalms 37:41 And the Lord will help them and deliver them; He will rescue them from the sinners and save them, because they have hoped in Him.
Psalms 38:1 Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger, nor correct me in your wrath.
Psalms 38:2 Because your arrows have struck me, and your hand has pressed down upon me.
Psalms 38:3 My body is in pain because of your anger, and my bones have no rest because of my sins.
Psalms 38:4 My sins have overwhelmed me; they are a heavy burden, too heavy for me to bear.
Psalms 38:5 My wounds are foul and festering because of my foolishness.
Psalms 38:6 I am bowed down and brought low; all day long I go about mourning.
Psalms 38:7 My loins are filled with fever, and there is no health in my body.
Psalms 38:8 I am feeble and utterly crushed; I groan because of the anguish of my heart.
Psalms 38:9 Lord, all my longing is before you; my sighing is not hidden from you.
Psalms 38:10 My heart pounds, my strength fails me; even the light of my eyes is gone from me.
Psalms 38:11 My friends and companions avoid me because of my affliction; my neighbors stand far off.
Psalms 38:12 Those who seek my life set traps for me, those who want to harm me speak of ruin and meditate treachery all day long.
Psalms 38:13 But I, like the deaf, do not hear; I am like the mute, who cannot open his mouth.
Psalms 38:14 I am like one who does not hear, whose mouth cannot offer a retort.
Psalms 38:15 I wait for you, Lord; you will answer, Lord my God.
Psalms 38:16 I said, “Do not let them gloat over me, those who triumph when my foot slips.”
Psalms 38:17 For I am ready to fall, and my pain is ever with me.
Psalms 38:18 I confess my iniquity; I am sorry for my sin.
Psalms 38:19 My enemies are vigorous, and those who hate me without cause are numerous.
Psalms 38:20 Those who repay good with evil, they slander me for pursuing good.
Psalms 38:21 Do not forsake me, Lord; do not be far from me, my God.
Psalms 38:22 Come quickly to help me, O Lord, my Savior.
Psalms 39:1 I said: “I will keep myself from sin, so that I do not sin with my words.” I put a watch over my mouth when wicked men were present, speaking against me.
Psalms 39:2 I was silent, and humbled myself, and held my tongue, even from doing good. But my pain was renewed.
Psalms 39:3 My heart grew hot within me, and in my meditation, a fire blazed up.
Psalms 39:4 I spoke then with my tongue: “Show me, Lord, what is my end, and what is the number of my days, so that I might know what I truly lack.”
Psalms 39:5 Behold, you have measured out my days, and my substance is as nothing before you. Yes, every man living is mere vanity.
Psalms 39:6 Truly, man walks about as a shadow, and he is troubled in vain. He gathers riches but doesn't know who will possess them.
Psalms 39:7 And now, what is my expectation? Is it not the Lord? And my hope is in you.
Psalms 39:8 Deliver me from all my iniquities. Do not make me a disgrace to the foolish.
Psalms 39:9 I was silent and did not open my mouth, because you have done this.
Psalms 39:10 Remove your plagues from me. I am worn out by the power of your hand.
Psalms 39:11 With rebuke, you have corrected man for iniquity. And like a moth, you have made his soul waste away. Yet, every man is but vanity.
Psalms 39:12 Hear my prayer, Lord, and heed my supplication. Give ear to my tears. Do not be silent, for I am a stranger before you and a pilgrim like all my fathers.
Psalms 39:13 Forgive me, that I may be refreshed before I go away and be seen no more.
Psalms 40:1 I waited and waited on the Lord, and He turned to me.
Psalms 40:2 He heard my prayers and took me out of the pit of misery and the mud of the swamp.
Psalms 40:3 He set my feet on solid ground, and made my steps sure.
Psalms 40:4 He put a new song in my mouth, a hymn to our God.
Psalms 40:5 Many will see and be afraid, and then they will trust in the Lord.
Psalms 40:6 Blessed is the man whose trust is in the Lord, and who has not looked at vanity and false madness.
Psalms 40:7 O Lord my God, You have done many wonderful things, and no one can match Your thoughts.
Psalms 40:8 I have proclaimed them, and spoken them, and they have multiplied beyond number.
Psalms 40:9 You didn't want sacrifices or offerings; rather, you have perfected my ears.
Psalms 40:10 You didn't ask for burnt offerings or sacrifices for sin, so I said, “Behold, I come.”
Psalms 40:11 It is written of me in the book: “I want to do Your will, O my God, and Your law is within my heart.”
Psalms 40:12 I have proclaimed Your justice in the great assembly; behold, I do not restrain my lips; O Lord, You know this.
Psalms 40:13 I have not hidden Your justice in my heart; I have proclaimed Your truth and Your salvation.
Psalms 40:14 I have not concealed Your mercy and Your truth from the great multitude.
Psalms 40:15 Don’t withhold Your mercy from me, O Lord; Your mercy and truth have always protected me.
Psalms 40:16 For evils without number have surrounded me; my sins have overtaken me, and I can’t see a way out.
Psalms 40:17 They are more than the hairs on my head, those who hate me without cause.
Psalms 40:18 Those who persecute me are strengthened, my unjust enemies; I was made to pay for what I did not steal.
Psalms 40:19 O God, don’t be far from me; my God, look upon me to help me.
Psalms 40:20 Let them be ashamed and disgraced, all who seek my life to take it away.
Psalms 40:21 Let those who wish me evil turn back and be ashamed.
Psalms 40:22 Let them be brought to immediate shame, those who say to me, “Well done, well done!”
Psalms 40:23 Let all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; and let those who love Your salvation always say, “May the Lord be glorified!”
Psalms 40:24 But I am poor and needy; the Lord cares for me.
Psalms 40:25 You are my helper and my protector; O my God, don’t delay.
Psalms 41:1 To the end, for David, in memory.
Psalms 41:2 Happy is the person who cares for the needy. In the day of evil, the Lord will free him.
Psalms 41:3 May the Lord preserve him, and may the Lord make him live. May He bless him upon the earth, and may He not give him over to the will of his enemies.
Psalms 41:4 May the Lord assist him on his bed of suffering. You have turned over the entire bed for him in his weakness.
Psalms 41:5 I said, "Lord, have mercy on me; heal my soul, because I have sinned against You."
Psalms 41:6 My enemies spoke evil against me. "When will he die, and when will his name perish?"
Psalms 41:7 And if he was entering to see me, he spoke in vain. His heart gathered iniquity for himself.
Psalms 41:8 He was cast out, and he spoke in the same way.
Psalms 41:9 All my enemies whispered against me. They were thinking up evil against me.
Psalms 41:10 They have planned an unjust word against me. "Does he who is sleeping not add to rise again?"
Psalms 41:11 For even the man of my peace, in whom I hoped, who ate my bread, greatly lifted his heel against me.
Psalms 41:12 But You, Lord, have mercy on me, and raise me up that I may repay them.
Psalms 41:13 By this, I have known that You have wanted me, because my enemy will not rejoice over me.
Psalms 41:14 But You have upheld me because of my innocence, and You have confirmed me in Your sight forever.
Psalms 41:15 Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from all eternity to eternity. So be it, so be it.
Psalms 42:1 Like a deer thirsting for water, my soul thirsts for You, O God.
Psalms 42:2 My soul thirsts for the living God;
Psalms 42:3 When will I come and appear before the face of God?
Psalms 42:4 My tears have been my bread day and night, while they say to me daily: "Where is your God?"
Psalms 42:5 I remember these things, and I pour out my soul within me:
Psalms 42:6 How I used to walk in the temple, as if to the house of God, among the sound of joy and thanksgiving, with a crowd celebrating a feast.
Psalms 42:7 Why are you sad, my soul? And why do you disquiet me?
Psalms 42:8 Hope in God, for I will still give praise to Him, the saving presence of my countenance.
Psalms 42:9 My God, my soul is troubled within me; therefore I will remember you from the land of the Jordan and of Hermon and from the little mountain.
Psalms 42:10 Deep calls to deep at the noise of your waterfalls;
Psalms 42:11 all your exalted waves and your billows have passed over me.
Psalms 42:12 By day the Lord commands his mercy, and at night his song.
Psalms 42:13 Let my prayer go to the God of my life, and I will say:
Psalms 42:14 “Why have you forgotten me? Why do I go about sad, while the enemy afflicts me?”
Psalms 42:15 As my bones are broken, the enemies who afflict me have reproached me.
Psalms 42:16 As they say to me daily: "Where is your God?"
Psalms 42:17 Why are you sad, my soul? And why do you disquiet me?
Psalms 42:18 Hope in God, for I will still give praise to Him, my salvation, and my God.
Psalms 43:1 Give me justice, O God, and defend my cause from a nation that isn’t holy. Deliver me from the hands of wicked and deceitful people.
Psalms 43:2 For You are the God who protects me: why have you rejected me? Why do I walk around so sad and downtrodden when my enemies are constantly bothering me?
Psalms 43:3 Send forth Your light and Your truth. Those things have guided me, and lead me back up to your holy mountain, and to Your tabernacles.
Psalms 43:4 Then I will go to the altar of God: to God, who gives joy to my youth.
Psalms 43:5 I will give thanks to You with a harp, O God, my God. Why are you sad, my soul? Why do you disturb me?
Psalms 43:6 Hope in God, because I will still give Him thanks. He is the salvation of my face, and He is my God.
Psalms 44:1 For the leader. A song for the sons of Korah, a prayer for understanding.
Psalms 44:2 Listen to this, all you nations. Understand this, all who live on Earth.
Psalms 44:3 Consider this, you who are of the earth, and all the sons of men. Both rich and poor come together, for all are equal.
Psalms 44:4 My mouth will speak wisdom, and my heart will ponder prudence.
Psalms 44:5 I will listen closely to a parable. I will solve the mystery by singing a song.
Psalms 44:6 Why should I fear trouble? The wickedness of my life seeks to surround me.
Psalms 44:7 They trust in their own strength, and boast in the abundance of their riches.
Psalms 44:8 No man can pay the price to save a brother. Man cannot give God the price of redemption.
Psalms 44:9 For he cannot pay to satisfy God's justice, nor give enough to save his own soul.
Psalms 44:10 For he will labor forever, and continue to live in his misery without end.
Psalms 44:11 He will not see corruption, when he sees wise men dying. The fool and the stupid will perish together.
Psalms 44:12 And they leave their riches to others.
Psalms 44:13 Their tombs will be their houses forever. Their dwellings will be from generation to generation.
Psalms 44:14 They have given names to the lands which they possess.
Psalms 44:15 But man, though living in honor, does not understand. He is compared to unthinking beasts, and becomes like them.
Psalms 44:16 This is the way of them that cause trouble. Their mouths approve of their own wickedness.
Psalms 44:17 Like sheep in the grave, death will feed on them.
Psalms 44:18 The just shall rule over them at the resurrection, and their strength will waste away in the grave, far from their glory.
Psalms 44:19 But God will redeem my soul from the power of hell, for He will receive me.
Psalms 44:20 Do not fear when a man becomes rich, or when the glory of his house is increased.
Psalms 44:21 For when he dies, he will take nothing. His glory will not follow him down.
Psalms 44:22 Because his soul, while he lives, is blessed. He will give thanks to You when You bless him.
Psalms 44:23 He will go to the generation of his fathers. And he will never again see the light.
Psalms 44:24 Man, while living in honor, does not understand. He is compared to unthinking beasts, and becomes like them.
Psalms 45:1 My heart swells with a message from God. I will write my poem to the King.
Psalms 45:2 My tongue will be like the ready pen of a skilled writer.
Psalms 45:3 You are the fairest of all men. Grace is poured out on your lips, and God has blessed you forever.
Psalms 45:4 Gird your sword upon your thigh, O mighty one.
Psalms 45:5 In your glory and your beauty, ride forth, and reign.
Psalms 45:6 Ride forth for truth, gentleness, and righteousness. Let your right hand perform awesome deeds.
Psalms 45:7 Your arrows are sharp, and nations will fall before you, piercing the hearts of the king's enemies.
Psalms 45:8 Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; a scepter of justice is the scepter of your kingdom.
Psalms 45:9 You love justice and hate wickedness; therefore, God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.
Psalms 45:10 Your robes are fragrant with myrrh, aloes, and cassia; from the ivory palaces, stringed instruments make you rejoice.
Psalms 45:11 Daughters of kings are among those held in honor; the queen stands at your right hand, adorned with gold from Ophir.
Psalms 45:12 Hear, O daughter, consider and incline your ear: forget your people and your father's house.
Psalms 45:13 And the king will desire your beauty; he is your lord, and you shall bow down to him.
Psalms 45:14 The people of Tyre will seek your favor with gifts; the rich among the people will seek your blessing.
Psalms 45:15 All glorious is the princess within; her gown is woven with gold.
Psalms 45:16 In embroidered garments she is led to the king; after her the virgins, her companions, are brought to you.
Psalms 45:17 They are led forth with gladness and rejoicing; they enter the palace of the king.
Psalms 45:18 Your sons will take the place of your fathers; you will make them princes throughout all the earth.
Psalms 45:19 I will cause your name to be remembered in all generations;
Psalms 45:20 therefore the peoples will praise you forever and ever.
Psalms 46:1 A song for the liturgical use of the sons of Korah, for the soul.
Psalms 46:2 God is our safe-haven and His power is our strength. He is the help we need during the tribulations that have found us.
Psalms 46:3 Therefore, we will not fear even when the earth is shaken. Even if the mountains are moved into the depths of the sea...
Psalms 46:4 Their waters have roared and foamed over; the mountains have trembled and been disturbed by His strength.
Psalms 46:5 The rush of the river brings joy to the city of God. The Most High sanctified His tabernacle.
Psalms 46:6 God is in the midst of the city, and it will not be moved. God will help it, even at the break of dawn.
Psalms 46:7 The nations were troubled and the kingdoms were inclined. God spoke, and the earth was moved.
Psalms 46:8 The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our protector.
Psalms 46:9 Come and see the works of the Lord, the amazing things He has done on Earth.
Psalms 46:10 He stops wars all over the Earth. He breaks the bow, shatters the spear, and burns the shields in the fire.
Psalms 46:11 Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, and I will be exalted in the earth.
Psalms 46:12 The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our protector.
Psalms 47:1 For the leader. A song. The sons of Korah composed this.
Psalms 47:2 All nations, clap your hands; sing praises to God with a voice of joy.
Psalms 47:3 For the Lord is high and to be feared. He is the great king over all the land.
Psalms 47:4 He subdued the people to us, and the nations under our feet.
Psalms 47:5 He chose our inheritance for us, the glory of Jacob whom he loved.
Psalms 47:6 God ascends amid shouts of joy, and the Lord, with the sound of the trumpet.
Psalms 47:7 Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises to our king, sing praises.
Psalms 47:8 For God is king of all the earth; sing praises with understanding.
Psalms 47:9 God reigns over all nations; God sits upon his holy throne.
Psalms 47:10 The princes of the people have gathered together with the God of Abraham. For the strong ones of the land are greatly exalted in their time.
Psalms 48:1 A song of the psalms, for the sons of Korah. The Lord is great, and worthy of all praise: in the city of our God, on his holy mountain.
Psalms 48:2 It is beautiful, the joy of all the earth, Mount Zion, and the sides of the north, the city of the great King.
Psalms 48:3 God is known in His houses, when He shall take her.
Psalms 48:4 For, behold, the kings of the earth are gathered: they have come together.
Psalms 48:5 They saw, and so they marveled; they were troubled, they were moved.
Psalms 48:6 Trembling took hold of them: there were pains like a woman in labor.
Psalms 48:7 With a strong wind, You will break the ships of Tarshish.
Psalms 48:8 As we have heard, so have we seen: in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God has founded her forever.
Psalms 48:9 We have received, O God, Your mercy, in the midst of You.
Psalms 48:10 According to Your name, O God, so also is Your praise to the ends of the earth: Your right hand is full of justice.
Psalms 48:11 Let Mount Zion rejoice, and let the daughters of Judah exult: because of Your judgments, O Lord.
Psalms 48:12 Go around Zion, and go around her: tell of her towers.
Psalms 48:13 Set your hearts on her power: and distribute it in her towers, that you may tell it in another generation.
Psalms 48:14 For this is God, our God forever, and for ages of ages: He will rule us forever.
Psalms 49:1 Listen to this, all you people;
Psalms 49:2 listen carefully, all who dwell on earth:
Psalms 49:3 people of all classes, people of all kinds, the wealthy and the poor.
Psalms 49:4 My mouth will declare wisdom;
Psalms 49:5 and the meditation of my heart will be prudence.
Psalms 49:6 I will incline my ear to a parable;
Psalms 49:7 I will open my proposition in the psalter.
Psalms 49:8 Why will I be afraid in the evil day? The iniquity of my heel will surround me.
Psalms 49:9 They trust in their own strength, and glory in the multitude of their riches.
Psalms 49:10 A brother will not redeem, nor will a man redeem, nor give to God his ransom,
Psalms 49:11 nor the price of the redemption of his soul.
Psalms 49:12 And he will labor in eternity, and will live forever.
Psalms 49:13 For he will not see corruption when he sees the wise dying;
Psalms 49:14 at the same time, the foolish and the stupid will perish: and they will leave their riches to others.
Psalms 49:15 And their sepulchers are their homes forever, their tabernacles from generation to generation.
Psalms 49:16 They set their tongues, and they called the lands by their names.
Psalms 49:17 And man, when he was in honor, did not understand.
Psalms 49:18 He is compared to the irrational beasts, and made similar to them.
Psalms 49:19 This is their way: it is a scandal to them: and afterwards they will be pleased in their mouth.
Psalms 49:20 As sheep are placed in hell: death will feed on them. And the just will rule over them in the morning: and their help will be consumed by old age in hell.
Psalms 49:21 But God will redeem my soul from the hand of hell, when he receives me.
Psalms 49:22 Do not fear when he becomes rich, and when the glory of his house is multiplied.
Psalms 49:23 For when he dies, he will take nothing.
Psalms 49:24 And his glory will not descend with him.
Psalms 49:25 Because his soul will be blessed in his life.
Psalms 49:26 He will confess to you when you receive, and you will repay him.
Psalms 49:27 He will enter into the generation of his fathers: he will never see the light.
Psalms 49:28 Man, when he was in honor, did not understand: he is compared to the irrational beasts, and made similar to them.
Psalms 50:1 Have mercy on me, God, according to Your mercy.
Psalms 50:2 And according to the abundance of Your compassion, erase my iniquity.
Psalms 50:3 Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
Psalms 50:4 For I acknowledge my iniquity, and my sin is always before me.
Psalms 50:5 Against You alone have I sinned, and done what is evil in Your sight, so that You may be justified in Your words, and prevail when You are judged.
Psalms 50:6 For behold, I was conceived in iniquities, and in sins did my mother conceive me.
Psalms 50:7 Behold, You have desired truth; You have made known to me the uncertain and hidden things of Your wisdom.
Psalms 50:8 You will sprinkle me with hyssop, and I shall be cleansed; You will wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
Psalms 50:9 You will give me joy and gladness; and the bones that were humbled shall rejoice.
Psalms 50:10 Turn Your face away from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.
Psalms 50:11 Create a clean heart in me, God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me.
Psalms 50:12 Do not cast me away from Your presence, and do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
Psalms 50:13 Restore to me the joy of Your salvation, and strengthen me with a willing spirit.
Psalms 50:14 Then I will teach the wicked Your ways, and sinners will be converted to You.
Psalms 50:15 Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, God, God of my salvation, and my tongue will rejoice in Your justice.
Psalms 50:16 O Lord, You will open my lips, and my mouth will declare Your praise.
Psalms 50:17 For if You had desired sacrifice, I would have given it; You will not delight in burnt offerings.
Psalms 50:18 The sacrifice for God is a contrite spirit; a contrite and humbled heart, God, You will not despise.
Psalms 50:19 Be gracious, O Lord, in Your good pleasure to Zion, that the walls of Jerusalem may be rebuilt.
Psalms 50:20 Then You will accept the sacrifice of justice, offerings, and burnt offerings; then they will place young bulls upon Your altar.
Psalms 51:1 Have mercy on me, O God, because of Your great mercy.
Psalms 51:2 And because of Your compassion, wipe away my iniquity.
Psalms 51:3 Wash me completely from my sin and cleanse me.
Psalms 51:4 Because I know my iniquities, my sins are always before me.
Psalms 51:5 I have sinned against You alone, and done what is evil in Your eyes, so that You are just in Your sentence, and righteous in Your judgment.
Psalms 51:6 Behold, I was conceived in iniquity, and in sin did my mother conceive me.
Psalms 51:7 Indeed, You love truth in the heart; You have made known to me the secrets of Your wisdom.
Psalms 51:8 Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
Psalms 51:9 Make me hear joy and gladness; that the bones You have crushed may rejoice.
Psalms 51:10 Turn Your face away from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.
Psalms 51:11 Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
Psalms 51:12 Do not cast me away from Your presence, and do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
Psalms 51:13 Restore to me the joy of Your salvation, and sustain me with a willing spirit.
Psalms 51:14 Then I will teach transgressors Your ways, and sinners will return to You.
Psalms 51:15 Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing of Your righteousness.
Psalms 51:16 O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will proclaim Your praise.
Psalms 51:17 For You do not delight in sacrifice; You would accept a burnt offering.
Psalms 51:18 My sacrifice, O God, is a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, You will not despise.
Psalms 51:19 Be pleased to do good to Zion in Your good pleasure; rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
Psalms 51:20 Then You will be pleased with sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings; then they will offer bulls on Your altar.
Psalms 52:1 For the director of music. A Psalm of David, reflecting deep sorrow.
Psalms 52:2 The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.”
Psalms 52:3 They are corrupt. They have done detestable deeds, none of them does good.
Psalms 52:4 God looks down from the sky on humankind, to see if there are any who understand, who seek after God.
Psalms 52:5 Everyone has turned away, together they have become useless; no one does good, not even one.
Psalms 52:6 Do all those evildoers not know? They devour my people as though they were bread.
Psalms 52:7 They do not call on God.
Psalms 52:8 They were in great fear, though there was no reason to fear, because God scattered the bones of those who pleased humanity. They were shamed, because God rejected them.
Psalms 52:9 Who will bring salvation for Israel from Zion? When God restores the fortunes of His people, Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad.
Psalms 53:1 To the end. A Psalm of David.
Psalms 53:2 The fool has said in his heart, "There is no God."
Psalms 53:3 They have become corrupt; they have become abominable in their wickedness. There is no one who does good.
Psalms 53:4 God looked down from the sky upon the sons of men, to see if there were any who understood, or sought God.
Psalms 53:5 All have turned aside; they have together become useless. There is none who does good, not even one.
Psalms 53:6 Will they not know, all who work iniquity, who devour my people as if they were bread?
Psalms 53:7 They have not called upon God.
Psalms 53:8 There they trembled with fear where there was no fear.
Psalms 53:9 For God has scattered the bones of those who please men; they are confused, because God has despised them.
Psalms 53:10 Who will give from Zion the salvation of Israel? When God returns the captivity of his people, Jacob will rejoice, and Israel will be glad.
Psalms 54:1 For the leader. A song of contemplation by David.
Psalms 54:2 Hear me, God, and listen to my prayer, and do not look away from my supplication.
Psalms 54:3 Pay attention to me, and hear me. I am troubled in my thoughts, and I am disturbed
Psalms 54:4 by the voice of the enemy, and by the oppression of the sinner.
Psalms 54:5 For they have poured wickedness upon me, and they were angry with me.
Psalms 54:6 My heart is troubled within me, and the fear of death has fallen upon me.
Psalms 54:7 Fear and trembling have come upon me, and darkness has covered me.
Psalms 54:8 And I said: “Who will give me wings like a dove, so I can fly away, and be at rest?”
Psalms 54:9 Behold, I have fled far away and remained in the wilderness.
Psalms 54:10 I was waiting for Him to save me from the spirit of the storm and the tempest.
Psalms 54:11 Hasten, Lord; divide their tongues; for I have seen wickedness and contradiction in the city.
Psalms 54:12 Day and night, wickedness surrounds it on its walls, and trouble is in its midst.
Psalms 54:13 Wickedness is in the midst of it, and deceit and fraud never depart from its streets.
Psalms 54:14 For it was not an enemy who reproached me, and I would have borne it. If he who hated me had spoken great things against me, I would perhaps have hidden myself.
Psalms 54:15 But it was you, a man of one mind with me, my guide and my acquaintance.
Psalms 54:16 Together, we took pleasure in food. We walked in the house of God with agreement.
Psalms 54:17 Let death come upon them, and let them go down to hell alive, for wickedness is in their dwellings, in their midst.
Psalms 54:18 But I cried out to God, and the Lord will save me.
Psalms 54:19 In the evening, in the morning, and at noon, I will tell and announce it. And He will hear my voice.
Psalms 54:20 He will redeem my soul in peace from those who call me. For they were with me, though they are many.
Psalms 54:21 May God hear and humble them—He who is before the ages. For there is no change in them, and they did not fear God.
Psalms 54:22 He stretched out his hand to repay. They have defiled His covenant.
Psalms 54:23 They were separated from the wrath of His countenance, and their hearts drew near.
Psalms 54:24 His words are softer than oil, but they are weapons.
Psalms 54:25 Cast your care upon the Lord, and He will nourish you. He will not give the just to be in a perpetual state of fluctuation.
Psalms 54:26 But you, God, will lead them into the pit of destruction. Men of blood and deceit will not live out half their days. But I will trust in you, Lord.
Psalms 55:1 For the leader. A song of David.
Psalms 55:2 Listen, O God, to my prayer. Don’t ignore my supplication.
Psalms 55:3 Hear me and answer me. I am troubled by my worries, and I am disturbed.
Psalms 55:4 Because of the enemy’s voice, and the sinner’s tribulation.
Psalms 55:5 Because they have brought unjust accusations against me. The sinners are so angry at me.
Psalms 55:6 My heart is troubled within me, and the terror of death has fallen on me.
Psalms 55:7 Fear and trembling have come upon me, and darkness has covered me.
Psalms 55:8 And I said: “Who will give me the wings of a dove, so I can fly away and find rest?”
Psalms 55:9 Behold, I have fled far away, and I dwell in the desert.
Psalms 55:10 I was waiting for the one who would save me from the spirit of storm and from a tempest.
Psalms 55:11 Lord, command this: destroy them, and divide their tongues.
Psalms 55:12 Because I see injustice and discord in the city.
Psalms 55:13 Day and night injustice will surround its walls.
Psalms 55:14 And in its midst is labor, and iniquity, and in its streets deceit and fraud will never depart.
Psalms 55:15 For if my enemy had cursed me, I would surely have endured it.
Psalms 55:16 And if the one who hated me had spoken great things against me, I would have perhaps hidden myself from him.
Psalms 55:17 But you, a man of my own heart, my leader, and my acquaintance,
Psalms 55:18 who together shared pleasant food; we walked in the house of God with harmony.
Psalms 55:19 Let death come upon them, and let them descend alive into hell: because wickedness is in their dwellings, in their midst.
Psalms 55:20 But I cried out to God, and the Lord will save me.
Psalms 55:21 Evening, morning, and noon I will tell the story, and I will announce it: and He will hear my voice.
Psalms 55:22 He will redeem my soul in peace from those who approach me: because there were many against me.
Psalms 55:23 May God hear and humble them, He who exists from before the ages.
Psalms 55:24 For there is no change for them, and they have not feared God.
Psalms 55:25 He stretched out his hand in retaliation; he profaned His covenant.
Psalms 55:26 They were divided by the anger of His countenance: and they approached His heart.
Psalms 55:27 His words were smoother than oil: and they themselves are like arrows.
Psalms 55:28 Cast your care upon the Lord, and He will nourish you: He will not allow the just to be shaken forever.
Psalms 55:29 But you, O God, will bring them down to the pit of destruction: men of blood and deceit will not live out their days. But I will hope in you, O Lord.

Psalms 56:2 I will hope in the shadow of your wings until iniquity passes.
Psalms 56:3 I will cry to the most high God: the God who has done good things for me.
Psalms 56:4 He sent from the sky, and freed me: He gave them to be mocked.
Psalms 56:5 God has sent his mercy and his truth.
Psalms 56:6 And he delivered my soul from the midst of lions: I slept, troubled.
Psalms 56:7 The sons of men are armed with teeth, arrows, and a sharp sword of the tongue.
Psalms 56:8 Be exalted above the heavens, God, and let your glory be in all the earth.
Psalms 56:9 They have caught my foot: they have afflicted my soul.
Psalms 56:10 They have thrown my soul into a pit.
Psalms 56:11 You have paid attention to me, Lord God.
Psalms 56:12 Awake, and arise, and rise up, my glory.
Psalms 56:13 I will arise to you: because you are my God.
Psalms 56:14 I will give praise to you in the people, Lord: and I will sing psalms to you in the nations.
Psalms 56:15 Because your mercy has been magnified up to the sky: and your truth is up to the clouds.
Psalms 56:16 Be exalted above the heavens, God.

Psalms 57:2 I take refuge in the shadow of Your protection until this trial passes.
Psalms 57:3 I will call to God, the Most High; to God who gave me good things.
Psalms 57:4 He will send help from the sky, and He will deliver me. He will make them ashamed, those who want to destroy me.
Psalms 57:5 God sent down His mercy and His truth.
Psalms 57:6 He rescued my soul from the lions. I was in a state of distress and couldn't sleep.
Psalms 57:7 They are children of men, but their teeth are like weapons, and their tongues are like sharp swords.

Psalms 58:1 For the director of music; do not destroy. A psalm of David.
Psalms 58:2 Do you really know how to speak justly? Judge what is right, sons of men.
Psalms 58:3 You have evil in your hearts. Violence is your work in the land.
Psalms 58:4 The wicked are estranged from the womb. They go astray from their birth, speaking lies.
Psalms 58:5 Their venom is like the poison of a snake. They are like a deaf viper, blocking its ears.
Psalms 58:6 It will not listen to the voice of charmers, or of a skilled enchanter.
Psalms 58:7 Break their teeth in their mouths, O God. Lord, break the fangs of the lions.
Psalms 58:8 Let them vanish like water flowing away. Let them be crushed before their arrows are released.
Psalms 58:9 Let them be like the wax that melts away. Let fire fall upon them; let them not see the sun.
Psalms 58:10 So that before your thorns can grow into a thicket, let the living be swept away in wrath.
Psalms 58:11 The just man will rejoice when he sees revenge. He will wash his hands in the blood of the sinner.
Psalms 58:12 Then men will say, "Surely there is a reward for the just." Surely God judges those on earth.
Psalms 59:1 To the end, lest thou destroy, a song of David, in the inscription of the title, when he burnt Mesopotamia of Syria, and Syria of Soba, and Joab returned, and smote in the valley of salt twelve thousand.

Psalms 59:3 You have disturbed the land, and have shaken it: heal the breaches thereof, for it has been moved.
Psalms 59:4 You have shewn your people hard things: you have given us to drink of the wine of sorrow.
Psalms 59:5 You have given a sign to those who fear you, that they may flee from before the bow.
Psalms 59:6 That your beloved ones may be delivered: save me with your right hand, and hear me.
Psalms 59:7 God spoke in his holy place: I will rejoice and divide Sichem, and measure out the valley of the tabernacles.
Psalms 59:8 Galaad is mine, and Manasses is mine: and Ephraim is the strength of my head.
Psalms 59:9 Judah is my king: Moab is the pot of my hope.
Psalms 59:10 In Idumea I will extend my shoe: to me the strangers are made friends.
Psalms 59:11 Who will bring me into the strong city? who will bring me into Idumea?
Psalms 59:12 Will not you, O God, who have cast us off? and will not you, O God, go forth with our powers?
Psalms 59:13 Give us help from trouble: for vain is the salvation of man.
Psalms 59:14 In God we will do great things: and he will tread down our enemies.

Psalms 61:3 I called to you from the ends of the earth, when my heart was overwhelmed. You set me high on a rock.
Psalms 61:4 For you have been my refuge. You have guided me and filled me with hope.
Psalms 61:5 You are my protector. And I trust you.
Psalms 61:6 Let me find joy in God again; and praise him again. All my being is in God.
Psalms 61:7 Turn your face away from my sins and cleanse all my wrongdoing.
Psalms 61:8 Create a clean heart in me, God, and renew a right spirit within me.
Psalms 61:9 Do not cast me away from your face, and do not take your Holy Spirit from me.
Psalms 61:10 Give me back the joy of your salvation, and strengthen me with a willing spirit.
Psalms 61:11 Then I will teach the wicked your ways, and sinners will return to you.
Psalms 61:12 Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, God, the God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing aloud of your goodness.

Psalms 61:14 For you will not delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it. You take no pleasure in burnt offerings.

Psalms 61:16 Do good to Zion in your good pleasure; rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
Psalms 61:17 Then you will delight in right sacrifices, offerings and burnt offerings; then young bulls will be offered on your altar.
Psalms 62:1 For the end. A Psalm of David.
Psalms 62:2 O God, my God, I watch for you at dawn.
Psalms 62:3 My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you!
Psalms 62:4 In a desolate land, an empty desert without water: I came to you in the sanctuary, that I might see your power and glory.
Psalms 62:5 Because your mercy is better than life; my lips shall praise you.
Psalms 62:6 So will I bless you in my life: and in your name I will lift up my hands.
Psalms 62:7 As with fat and richness is my soul filled: and with lips of joy my mouth shall praise you.
Psalms 62:8 If I have remembered you upon my bed, in the morning I will meditate on you.
Psalms 62:9 Because you have been my helper, and in the protection of your wings I will rejoice.
Psalms 62:10 My soul has adhered to you: your right hand has taken me up.
Psalms 62:11 But they have sought my soul in vain: they shall enter into the lower parts of the earth.
Psalms 62:12 They shall be given into the hands of the sword: they shall be the portions of foxes.
Psalms 62:13 But the king shall rejoice in God; everyone who swears by him shall be praised: because the mouth of those who speak wicked things has been stopped.

Psalms 63:2 My soul thirsts for you; I have such a deep desire for you!
Psalms 63:3 In the land that's barren, and without a path, and without water.
Psalms 63:4 I long to be with you in the holy temple, to behold your power and your glory.
Psalms 63:5 Because your mercy is better than life; my lips will praise you.
Psalms 63:6 So I will bless you for as long as I live, and in your name I will lift up my hands.
Psalms 63:7 My soul is satisfied as with the richest foods, and my mouth will praise you with joyful lips.
Psalms 63:8 When I remember you upon my bed, I meditate on you during the night.
Psalms 63:9 Because you have been my help, and under the shadow of your wings I will sing.
Psalms 63:10 My soul clings to you; your right hand upholds me.
Psalms 63:11 But those who seek to destroy my soul will go down into the depths of the earth.
Psalms 63:12 They shall be given over to the sword; they shall be the portion of the foxes.
Psalms 63:13 But the king will rejoice in God; everyone who swears by him will be praised, because the mouths of those who speak wickedness are stopped.
Psalms 64:1 For the leader: A psalm of David.
Psalms 64:2 Praise is due to you, God, in Zion. Vows are paid to you in Jerusalem.
Psalms 64:3 Hear my prayer. All men will come to you.
Psalms 64:4 Our sins and weaknesses are too great for us, but by your grace, you forgive our sins.
Psalms 64:5 How blessed are those whom you have chosen to be with you, and they will dwell with you in your courts.
Psalms 64:6 We will be filled with blessings in your house. Your temple is holy, full of wonders and righteousness.
Psalms 64:7 Hear us, O God, our Savior. You are the hope of all the ends of the earth, and for those far away on the sea.
Psalms 64:8 You established the mountains by your power, surrounded by strength.
Psalms 64:9 You calm the deep waters with your voice.
Psalms 64:10 The waves and swells crash, due to your anger.
Psalms 64:11 Those who dwell in the farthest reaches of the earth fear your signs. You bring forth the morning and evening with joy.
Psalms 64:12 You visit the earth, and make it fruitful. You greatly enrich it.
Psalms 64:13 God's river is filled with water. You provide their food because you prepared the earth to be so.
Psalms 64:14 You cause the streams to overflow. You make the earth flourish.
Psalms 64:15 The ground is saturated with water. The new growth rejoices. You crown the year with your bounty.
Psalms 64:16 The Lord blesses the earth. You crown the year with your bounty.
Psalms 64:17 The pastures of the wilderness are filled with plenty and the hills are joyful.
Psalms 64:18 The flocks of sheep cover the hills. The valleys are covered in grain. They all sing your praises.

Psalms 66:1 For the choir director, for the musicians. A psalm of David.
Psalms 66:2 Sing joyfully to God, all the earth; sing a psalm to His name; give glory to His praise.

Psalms 66:4 Let all the earth worship You, and sing to You; let them sing a psalm to Your name.
Psalms 66:5 Come and see the works of God; He is awesome in his counsel toward all of mankind.
Psalms 66:6 He turned the sea into dry land; they went through the river on foot; we will rejoice in Him.
Psalms 66:7 He reigns forever by His power; His eyes look upon the nations: let those who provoke Him not become proud.
Psalms 66:8 Bless our God, O peoples, and make the sound of His praise heard,
Psalms 66:9 who keeps my soul in life, and did not allow my feet to be moved.
Psalms 66:10 For you have tried us, O God; You have tested us in fire, just as silver is tested.
Psalms 66:11 You led us into the snare; You placed afflictions upon our backs.
Psalms 66:12 You set men over our heads; we went through fire and water: and You brought us out into refreshment.
Psalms 66:13 I will go into Your house with burnt offerings; I will pay You my vows which my lips have uttered,
Psalms 66:14 and which my lips promised in my tribulation.
Psalms 66:15 I will offer You burnt offerings of fatlings with the incense of rams; I will offer You bulls with goats.
Psalms 66:16 Come, hear, and I will tell, all you who fear God, how much He has done for my soul.
Psalms 66:17 I cried out to Him with my mouth, and I exalted Him with my tongue.
Psalms 66:18 If I had looked upon iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not have heard me.
Psalms 66:19 But God did hear me, and attended to the voice of my supplication.
Psalms 66:20 Blessed be God, who did not reject my prayer, nor His mercy toward me.

Psalms 67:5 Let all the nations thank You, God. Yes, let all the nations thank You.
Psalms 67:6 The earth has yielded its harvest. May God, even our God, give us His blessing.
