Psalms 119:1 Blessed are those with a pure heart: who walk according to the law of the Lord.
Psalms 119:2 Those who study God's testimony are blessed; with their whole heart, they seek Him.
Psalms 119:3 The wicked do not travel in His paths.
Psalms 119:4 You commanded that Your laws be guarded very carefully.
Psalms 119:5 Oh, that my ways would be set straight, to guard your teachings!
Psalms 119:6 I won't be ashamed when I understand all your commands.
Psalms 119:7 I will give thanks to you with the direction of my heart: in that I have learned the judgments of your justice.
Psalms 119:8 I will keep your teachings: do not abandon me, ever and always.
Psalms 119:9 How does a young man correct his path? By keeping your instructions, by obeying what God teaches.
Psalms 119:10 With all my heart, I have sought you: do not let me turn away from your commands.
Psalms 119:11 In my heart, I hid your words of truth, so that I might not sin against you.
Psalms 119:12 You are blessed, Lord: teach me your judgments.
Psalms 119:13 In my own lips, I have announced all your judgments, and I do not fear what awaits.
Psalms 119:14 I find joy in the things you teach, like the joy one finds in vast riches.
Psalms 119:15 I will focus on Your commandments, and I will consider Your ways.
Psalms 119:16 I will meditate on Your instructions: I will not forget Your sayings.
Psalms 119:17 Help me, your servant. Give me life, and I will keep your words.
Psalms 119:18 Open my eyes so I may understand and consider the wonders of your law.
Psalms 119:19 I am a sojourner on the land. Do not hide Your commandments from me.
Psalms 119:20 My soul desired to desire Your laws, in every era and season.
Psalms 119:21 You have rebuked the arrogant. Cursed are those who abandon your commandments.
Psalms 119:22 Take away from me all the shame and contempt: because I have sought after your testimonies.
Psalms 119:23 The leaders sat and spoke against me, but your servant was occupied with your commandments.
Psalms 119:24 For your divine decrees are my meditation, and I find joy in your commandments, which are a sign of God’s justice.
Psalms 119:25 My soul adheres to the dust: give me life according to your word.
Psalms 119:26 I have recounted my ways to you, and you have answered me: teach me how to live according to your will.
Psalms 119:27 Make me understand how your rules are right, and I will keep them and think about your wonders.
Psalms 119:28 My soul is in deep distress: strengthen me in your words.
Psalms 119:29 Remove the path of wickedness from me, and have mercy on me according to Your law.
Psalms 119:30 I have chosen the way of truth; I haven’t forgotten Your teachings.
Psalms 119:31 I have adhered to Your testimonies, Lord. Don't ever let me be ashamed.
Psalms 119:32 I ran the path of Your commandments, when You expanded my heart.
Psalms 119:33 Show me, Lord, the path of Your commandments. I will seek it always.
Psalms 119:34 Give to me the ability to understand Your law, and I will search it: and I will keep it in my whole heart.
Psalms 119:35 Show me the path of your commandments, because this path I have chosen.
Psalms 119:36 Turn my heart to Your testimonies, and not to greed.
Psalms 119:37 Keep my eyes from seeing vanity: give me life through Your law.
Psalms 119:38 Fulfill your promise to me. Make me honor you, because I am your servant.
Psalms 119:39 Remove my shame, which I have suspected of myself: because your judgments are pleasant.
Psalms 119:40 See, I've desired Your commands. Grant me life through Your justice.
Psalms 119:41 Let Your mercy come upon me, Lord. Grant me salvation, as You have promised.
Psalms 119:42 And I will respond to those who insult me because I trust in Your words.
Psalms 119:43 And never remove the truth from my mouth forever, because I have put my hope in Your judgments.
Psalms 119:44 And I will always keep Your law: for all of time, and for all of time to come.
Psalms 119:45 I traveled in a wide-open place because I sought out Your commands.
Psalms 119:46 I spoke of your testimonies in front of kings, and I wasn't ashamed.
Psalms 119:47 And I continued to think about Your commandments, which I love.
Psalms 119:48 And I lifted up my hands toward Your commands, which I love, and I have meditated on Your righteous rulings.
Psalms 119:49 Remember what you promised, as a servant to you—the one in whom you gave me hope.
Psalms 119:50 This is my comfort, from my lowly state: for your word brought me back to life.
Psalms 119:51 Arrogant people were behaving wickedly everywhere; but I didn't stop following your law.
Psalms 119:52 I have remembered Your judgments from of old, Lord, and have been comforted.
Psalms 119:53 My own being was seized by fear for sinners, those who abandon your law.
Psalms 119:54 Your decrees have been the subject of my songs, and they were so wonderful to me, during my time of wandering.
Psalms 119:55 I remembered Your name in the darkness, O Lord;
and I kept Your law.
Psalms 119:56 This will be my lot; for I have searched for your directives.
Psalms 119:57 My portion, O Lord, I have resolved to keep Your law.
Psalms 119:58 I have pleaded with you with all my heart, God; show mercy to me according to your promise.
Psalms 119:59 I thought about my ways,
and I turned my feet to your testimonies.
Psalms 119:60 I am ready, and I am not hesitant to keep your commands.
Psalms 119:61 The ropes of sin ensnared me; but I have not forgotten your law.
Psalms 119:62 In the middle of the night, I would rise to give thanks to you, because of the just decisions that come from you.
Psalms 119:63 I am a companion to all who hold you in awe,
and to those who faithfully keep Your commandments.
Psalms 119:64 Your mercy, O Lord, fills the entire earth. Teach me Your commands.
Psalms 119:65 You have been good to your servant, O Lord, according to your word.
Psalms 119:66 Teach me your goodness, Your instruction, and Your knowledge, because I have believed in Your commands.
Psalms 119:67 Before I was humbled, I made a mistake: and because of that, I have kept Your teaching.
Psalms 119:68 You are good, O Lord, and in Your goodness, teach me Your ways.
Psalms 119:69 The arrogance of the proud has caused many afflictions to me; but I will still search for your commandments with all my heart.
Psalms 119:70 Their heart has become thick, like curdled milk. But I have always focused on your divine instruction.
Psalms 119:71 It was good for me that you humbled me, so that I might learn your statutes.
Psalms 119:72 It is good for me that Your Law has been established, more valuable to me than thousands of gold and silver coins.
Psalms 119:73 Your hands made me, and formed me with care.
Grant me understanding, and I will learn your commands.
Psalms 119:74 Those who fear you, Lord, will see me and will rejoice, because I have placed my hope in your words.
Psalms 119:75 I know, Lord, that your judgments are right; and in your faithfulness you have humbled me.
Psalms 119:76 Let Your mercy be my comfort, as You promised Your servant.
Psalms 119:77 Let Your mercy come to me, so that I may live; because Your law is my constant meditation.
Psalms 119:78 Let the proud be put to shame; they have done injustice and acted wickedly against me. But I will continue to meditate on your commands.
Psalms 119:79 Let those who fear you and know your teachings turn to me.

May those who reverence God by living according to His revealed will turn their attention to me.
Psalms 119:80 May my heart be sound in your ways, so that I will not be ashamed.
Psalms 119:81 My soul grew weak awaiting your salvation; but I put my hope in your word.
Psalms 119:82 My eyes grew tired from waiting for your promise, as I kept asking, "When will you bring me comfort?"
Psalms 119:83 Because I have become like a wineskin in the frost;
I have not forgotten your statutes.
Psalms 119:84 How many days are left for your servant? When will you bring justice against those who are persecuting me?
Psalms 119:85 The enemies of God’s law have tried to destroy me with their wicked teachings; but I will not turn away from your law.
Psalms 119:86 All of your commands are truth. They have pursued me unjustly; help me.
Psalms 119:87 They tried to destroy me completely on earth; but I did not turn away from Your commands.
Psalms 119:88 Because of your steadfast love, keep me alive: and I will obey the teachings that come from your mouth.
Psalms 119:89 Eternally, O Lord, your Word remains in the sky.
Psalms 119:90 Through all generations your faithfulness endures.
Your truth is established forever; you founded the land, and it remains.
Psalms 119:91 By your decree the days continue, because all things are in your service.
Psalms 119:92 Had not your Law been my constant meditation,
I would have perished long ago from my humiliations.
Psalms 119:93 I will never forget your clear instructions, because through them you have given me new life.
Psalms 119:94 I belong to you and you alone, so please rescue me, for I have searched for your divine judgments.
Psalms 119:95 Sinners were waiting to ambush me and destroy me; I am understanding your testimonies.
Psalms 119:96 I have seen the end of all things; your commandment is exceedingly broad.
Psalms 119:97 How I loved your law, O Lord! It is my constant meditation all the day long.
Psalms 119:98 Your commandment has made me wiser than my enemies because it is with me forever.
Psalms 119:99 I understood more than all my teachers,
because your testimonies are my constant meditation.
Psalms 119:100 From my understanding, I've learned more than from all the teachers, because I have always sought to obey your instructions.
Psalms 119:101 I have kept my feet from every evil path, so that I may obey your teachings.
Psalms 119:102 I have not strayed from your decrees: because you have established the law for me.
Psalms 119:103 How sweet your words are to my mouth,
sweeter than honey to my lips.
Psalms 119:104 From your commands I have gained understanding; therefore I hate every path of wickedness.
Psalms 119:105 Your Word is like a lamp for my feet,
and a light for my path.
Psalms 119:106 I have sworn, and I will carry out my vow, to observe the righteous judgments of your law.
Psalms 119:107 I have been brought low in every way, O Lord;
strengthen me and give me life according to Your promises.
Psalms 119:108 Make my offerings from my mouth pleasing, Lord, and teach me your judgments.
Psalms 119:109 My soul is constantly in my hands, and I have not forgotten your law.
Psalms 119:110 Trouble-makers have set a trap for me, but I have not strayed from your instructions.
Psalms 119:111 I have made your testimonies my lifelong inheritance, because they are the joy of my heart.
Psalms 119:112 I have set my heart to do Your statutes forever, because of the reward.
Psalms 119:113 I hated those who were wicked, and I loved your Law.
Psalms 119:114 You are my shield and my protector. I have placed all my hope in your word.
Psalms 119:115 Turn away from me, you wicked people; I will obey the commands of my God.
Psalms 119:116 Uphold me according to your promise, and I will live, and do not let me be disappointed in my hopes.
Psalms 119:117 Help me, and I will be saved.
And I will meditate on Your eternal decrees forever.
Psalms 119:118 You have rejected everyone who abandons your laws. Their thoughts are wrong, and so they must be set aside.
Psalms 119:119 I consider all the godless people on earth to be traitors, and for that reason I love your testimonies.
Psalms 119:120 My flesh is pierced with Your fear; for I am in awe of Your judgments.
Psalms 119:121 I have done what is right and just. Do not hand me over to those who oppress me.
Psalms 119:122 Receive your servant for his benefit; may the proud not slander me.
Psalms 119:123 My eyes have grown weary, longing for your salvation; and for your promise of righteousness.
Psalms 119:124 Deal with me, Your servant, according to Your mercy,
and teach me Your commandments.
Psalms 119:125 I am your servant: grant me understanding, that I may know your decrees.
Psalms 119:126 It is time to act, O Lord,
because they have disregarded Your law.
Psalms 119:127 I have loved your commandments more than gold and precious stones.
Psalms 119:128 Because of this, I keep my life aligned with all your commandments; I have hated every path of wickedness.
Psalms 119:129 Your testimonies are amazing; therefore my soul has searched them out.
Psalms 119:130 The declaration of your words brings illumination
and gives understanding to the simple.
Psalms 119:131 I opened my mouth, and I drew in your Spirit, because I longed for your commands.
Psalms 119:132 Look upon me, and have mercy: according to the divine plan for those who love Your name.
Psalms 119:133 Direct my steps according to Your Word,
and do not let any injustice rule over me.
Psalms 119:134 Redeem me from the slanders of men; and I will keep Your commandments.
Psalms 119:135 Let Your face shine upon Your servant; and teach me Your judgments.
Psalms 119:136 My eyes have streamed water; because they did not keep your law.
Psalms 119:137 You are just, O Lord, and your judgment is righteous.
Psalms 119:138 You commanded justice, and your truth and promises, which are everlasting, guiding me always.
Psalms 119:139 My fervent devotion consumes me, for my enemies have forgotten your words.
Psalms 119:140 Your promise is like pure gold, incredibly valuable and refined by fire: and I, your servant, love it.
Psalms 119:141 I am still young and unrespected; however, I have never forgotten Your commands.
Psalms 119:142 Your justice, O Lord, is eternal justice: and your law is truth.
Psalms 119:143 Trouble and distress have found me. Your commandments are my constant meditation.
Psalms 119:144 Your testimony is always righteous; grant me understanding, and I will live.
Psalms 119:145 I cried out with my whole heart. Answer me, O Lord; I will seek Your righteous decrees.
Psalms 119:146 I cried out to you, "Save me!" so that I may keep your commandments.
Psalms 119:147 I was up before dawn, and I cried out to you; I put my hope in your promises.
Psalms 119:148 My eyes saw you before the morning light began to travel; I wanted to meditate on your words.
Psalms 119:149 Hear my voice according to Your mercy, O Lord; give me life according to Your judgment.
Psalms 119:150 Those who pursue me with evil have come close.
But they have turned away from your law.
Psalms 119:151 You are near, O Lord,
and all Your ways are faithfulness.
Psalms 119:152 I knew from the very beginning about your instructions:
because you established them eternally.
Psalms 119:153 Look at my suffering, and save me. I haven't forgotten Your teachings.
Psalms 119:154 Judge my cause, and deliver me: give me life according to your promise.
Psalms 119:155 Salvation is far from sinners: because they have not sought out your teachings.
Psalms 119:156 Your many mercies, Lord: give me life according to Your judgment.
Psalms 119:157 Many who were pursuing me, and troubling me, yet from your instructions I did not turn aside.
Psalms 119:158 I saw the people who strayed from God's path, and they were wasting away: because they did not keep your commands.
Psalms 119:159 I am keenly aware of how much I have loved your commands, Lord;
by your mercy, bring me back to life and give me strength.
Psalms 119:160 The beginning of Your words is truth; all the eternal judgments of Your justice.
Psalms 119:161 Princes have persecuted me for nothing. My heart has been afraid of your words.
Psalms 119:162 I will rejoice over your teachings; it is like finding much plunder.
Psalms 119:163 I have hated falsehood, and I detest it; but Your Law I have loved.
Psalms 119:164 Seven times a day I have given praise to you, for your righteous judgments.
Psalms 119:165 There is great peace for those who love your law; and nothing causes them to stumble.
Psalms 119:166 I have trusted in Your salvation, O Lord; and I have loved Your commandments.
Psalms 119:167 My soul kept Your testimonies; and I loved them vehemently.
Psalms 119:168 I have kept your commands and your testimony: for all my ways are visible before you.
Psalms 119:169 May my prayer come to You, O Lord, according to Your Word. Give me understanding so I can know Your law.
Psalms 119:170 Let my prayer enter into God's presence; O Lord, set me free according to Your decree.
Psalms 119:171 My lips will overflow with singing Your praises, when You teach me Your divine commands.
Psalms 119:172 My tongue will declare Your decrees: for all Your commands are just.
Psalms 119:173 May your hand be near to save me, because I have chosen your commands.
Psalms 119:174 I have longed for Your salvation, O Lord; and Your law is my meditation.
Psalms 119:175 My very life and soul will live on. My life will be sustained, and it will praise you.
Your just decrees are my support.
Psalms 119:176 I have strayed, like a lost sheep; seek out your servant, for I have not forgotten your commandments.
Psalms 120:1 A song of ascents. I cried out to the Lord when I was afflicted, and He heard me.
Psalms 120:2 O Lord, deliver my soul from wicked lips, and from a deceitful tongue.
Psalms 120:3 What will be given to you, or what will be added to you, for a deceitful tongue?
Psalms 120:4 Sharp arrows of the powerful, with coals of the deserts.
Psalms 120:5 Woe is me, because my sojourning has been prolonged! I have dwelt with the inhabitants of Cedar;
Psalms 120:6 My soul has been a long time a sojourner.
Psalms 120:7 I was peaceful with those who hated peace: when I spoke to them, they attacked me.
Psalms 121:1 A song of ascents. I raised my eyes to the mountains, from where will my help come to me?
Psalms 121:2 My help comes from the Lord, Who created the universe and the earth.
Psalms 121:3 He will not let your foot slip, nor will the one who watches over you slumber.
Psalms 121:4 Behold, He does not slumber or sleep, the one who watches over Israel.
Psalms 121:5 The Lord watches over you; the Lord is your protection, at your right hand.
Psalms 121:6 The sun will not burn you during the day, nor the moon at night.
Psalms 121:7 The Lord protects you from all evil; may the Lord guard your soul.
Psalms 121:8 The Lord will protect your going out and your coming in, from now on and forever.
Psalms 122:1 A song of ascents, by David.
Psalms 122:2 I was joyful when they said to me, “Let us go to the house of the Lord!”
Psalms 122:3 Our feet were standing in your courtyards, O Jerusalem.
Psalms 122:4 Jerusalem is built as a city, all joined together:
Psalms 122:5 There the tribes went up, the tribes of the Lord, as it was the testimony of Israel, to give praise to the name of the Lord.
Psalms 122:6 For there were set thrones for judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
Psalms 122:7 Pray for the things that make for the peace of Jerusalem, that those who love you may be abundant with gifts.
Psalms 122:8 May peace be within your walls, and prosperity in your towers.
Psalms 122:9 For the sake of my brothers and those near me, I will speak of peace.
Psalms 122:10 Because of the house of the Lord our God, I have sought good things for you.
Psalms 123:1 A Song of Ascents. Unless the Lord builds a home, the builders labor in vain. Unless the Lord protects the city, the watchman guards it in vain.
Psalms 123:2 It is useless to wake up before dawn. You who work so hard to earn a living, you will still be left with little.
Psalms 123:3 For those who trust in God, He gives rest. Behold, sons are a heritage from the Lord, the reward of the fruit of the womb.
Psalms 123:4 As arrows are in the hand of a warrior, so are the children of one's youth.
Psalms 123:5 Happy is the man who has filled his quiver with them. They will not be ashamed when they fight against their enemies in the gates of the city.
Psalms 124:1 A Song of Ascents. If the Lord hadn't been on our side—let Israel say so:
Psalms 124:2 If the Lord hadn't been on our side when men rose up against us,
Psalms 124:3 they would have swallowed us alive when their fury blazed against us.
Psalms 124:4 The flood waters might have drowned us.
Psalms 124:5 The torrent of their anger surged over our souls.
Psalms 124:6 We might have been swept away by an intolerable flood.
Psalms 124:7 Blessed be the Lord, who didn't give us as prey to their teeth.
Psalms 124:8 We escaped like a bird from the fowler’s snare.
Psalms 124:9 The snare was broken, and we were freed.
Psalms 124:10 Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made the universe and the earth.
Psalms 125:1 A song of the steps.
Psalms 125:2 “If the Lord hadn't been on our side,” let Israel say:
Psalms 125:3 “If the Lord hadn't been on our side when men rose up against us,”
Psalms 125:4 They would have swallowed us alive then.
Psalms 125:5 Maybe the flood waters would have washed us away.
Psalms 125:6 Our soul passed through the great rushing waters.
Psalms 125:7 Maybe our soul would have passed through the unbearable waters.
Psalms 125:8 Blessed be the Lord, because He did not give us over as prey to their teeth.
Psalms 125:9 Our soul, like a bird, was freed from the trap of the hunters:
Psalms 125:10 the trap was broken, and we were set free.
Psalms 125:11 Our help is in the name of the Lord, the one who made the universe and the earth.

Psalms 126:3 The Lord has done great things with us: we were filled with joy.
Psalms 126:4 Turn back our captivity, O Lord, as in the torrents of the south.
Psalms 126:5 Those who sow in tears, shall reap in exultation.
Psalms 126:6 They went forth weeping, casting seeds. But they will come again with happiness, carrying their sheaves.

Psalms 128:3 Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine in the inner parts of your house.
Psalms 128:4 Your children will be like olive plants all around your table.
Psalms 128:5 Behold, thus shall the man be blessed who fears God.
Psalms 128:6 May God bless you from Zion, and may you see the good things of Jerusalem all the days of your life.
Psalms 128:7 May you see your children's children, and may there be peace upon Israel.

Psalms 129:2 Lord, hear my voice.

Psalms 129:4 If You, Lord, should mark iniquities, Lord, who shall stand?
Psalms 129:5 But there is forgiveness with You, that You may be feared, Lord.

Psalms 129:7 From the morning watch until night, let Israel hope in the Lord.
Psalms 129:8 Because with the Lord there is mercy and His redemption is plentiful.
Psalms 129:9 And He will redeem Israel from all their iniquities.

Psalms 131:1 Lord, my heart is not puffed up with pride, nor have my eyes turned to arrogance.
Psalms 131:2 I have not occupied myself with great things, nor with wonders beyond my ability.

Psalms 131:4 as a weaned child on its mother's lap, so is my soul.

Psalms 132:1 A song of ascents. Remember, O Lord, David, and all his meekness.
Psalms 132:2 How he swore an oath to the Lord and promised a vow to the God of Jacob:
Psalms 132:3 “I will not enter into my house, nor will I go up to my bed,
Psalms 132:4 I will not give sleep to my eyes, nor slumber to my eyelids,
Psalms 132:5 nor rest to my temples, until I find a place for the Lord, a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.”
Psalms 132:6 Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah: we found it in the fields of the forest.
Psalms 132:7 Let us go into his tabernacle; let us worship in the place where his feet stood.
Psalms 132:8 Arise, O Lord, into your rest, you and the ark of your holiness.
Psalms 132:9 Let your priests be clothed with justice, and let your holy ones rejoice.
Psalms 132:10 For the sake of your servant David, do not turn away the face of your Christ.
Psalms 132:11 The Lord swore to David in truth, and He will not change His mind: “From the fruit of your womb I will set upon your throne.”
Psalms 132:12 “If your sons keep my covenant and my testimonies that I will teach them, then their sons also will sit upon your throne forever.”
Psalms 132:13 For the Lord has chosen Zion; He has chosen it to be His dwelling.
Psalms 132:14 “This is my rest forever; here I will dwell, for I have chosen it.”
Psalms 132:15 I will bless her widow and bless her poor with bread.
Psalms 132:16 I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her holy ones will rejoice.
Psalms 132:17 There I will cause the horn of David to spring forth; I have prepared a lamp for my Christ.
Psalms 132:18 I will clothe his enemies with shame, but upon him my holiness will flourish.
Psalms 133:1 A song of ascents. How very good and how very pleasant it is when brothers dwell together in unity.
Psalms 133:2 It is like the most precious oil that was poured on the head, that ran down the beard, the beard of Aaron, running down his garment’s collar.
Psalms 133:3 It is like the dew of Hermon that falls on Mount Zion, for there the Lord has commanded the blessing and life forevermore.
Psalms 134:1 Praise the Lord's name! All you servants of God, praise the Lord!
Psalms 134:2 You stand in the house of the Lord, in the courtyards of our God’s house.
Psalms 134:3 Praise the Lord, because the Lord is good! Sing to His name, because His name is sweet.
Psalms 134:4 For the Lord chose Jacob as His own, Israel for his inheritance.
Psalms 134:5 For I know that the Lord is great, and our God is above all other gods.
Psalms 134:6 The Lord does whatever He wants in the universe and on the earth, in the sea and in all the depths.
Psalms 134:7 He brings up clouds from the ends of the earth; He makes lightning for the rain.
Psalms 134:8 He sends out the winds from His storehouses.
Psalms 134:9 He struck down the firstborn of Egypt, from man to beast.
Psalms 134:10 He sent signs and wonders into the middle of you, Egypt; against Pharaoh and all his servants.
Psalms 134:11 He struck down many nations, and killed strong kings.
Psalms 134:12 He killed Seon the king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan.
Psalms 134:13 He gave their land as an inheritance, an inheritance to Israel, His people.
Psalms 134:14 Lord, Your name lasts forever; Lord, Your memory endures from one generation to the next.
Psalms 134:15 For the Lord will judge His people, and will have compassion on His servants.
Psalms 134:16 The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the works of human hands.
Psalms 134:17 They have mouths, but they don't speak; they have eyes, but they don't see.
Psalms 134:18 They have ears, but they don't hear; there is no breath in their mouths.
Psalms 134:19 Those who make them are like them, and so are all who trust in them.
Psalms 134:20 O house of Israel, bless the Lord; O house of Aaron, bless the Lord.
Psalms 134:21 O house of Levi, bless the Lord; you who fear the Lord, bless the Lord.
Psalms 134:22 May the Lord be blessed from Zion, He who dwells in Jerusalem.
Psalms 135:1 Give thanks to the Lord, because He is good, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:2 Give thanks to the God of gods, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:3 Give thanks to the Lord of lords, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:4 He alone does great wonders, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:5 He made the universe by His wisdom, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:6 He established the earth upon the waters, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:7 He made the great lights, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:8 The sun to rule the day, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:9 The moon and stars to rule the night, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:10 He struck down the firstborn of Egypt, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:11 He led Israel out from among them, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:12 With a strong hand and an outstretched arm, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:13 He divided the Red Sea into parts, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:14 And led Israel through the midst of it, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:15 He overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:16 He led His people through the desert, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:17 He struck down great kings, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:18 And killed mighty kings, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:19 Sehon, king of the Amorites, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:20 And Og, king of Bashan, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:21 And gave their land as a heritage, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:22 A heritage to Israel His servant, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:23 Who remembered us in our low estate, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:24 And delivered us from our enemies, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:25 Who gives food to all flesh, because His mercy endures forever.
Psalms 135:26 Give thanks to the God of the universe, because His mercy endures forever.

Psalms 137:1 By the rivers of Babylon, we sat and wept when we remembered Zion.
Psalms 137:2 We hung our instruments of music in the willows there.
Psalms 137:3 For there, those who had taken us captive asked for a song, and those who had led us away asked for a hymn.
Psalms 137:4 Sing us one of the songs of Zion!
Psalms 137:5 How can we sing the Lord's song in a foreign land?
Psalms 137:6 If I forget you, Jerusalem, may my right hand be forgotten!
Psalms 137:7 If I do not remember you, if I do not prefer Jerusalem above my chief joy...
Psalms 137:8 Lord, remember the children of Edom on the day of Jerusalem, who said: "Raze it, raze it, down to its foundation."
Psalms 137:9 O daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction: blessed is he who repays you for what you have done to us!
Psalms 137:10 Blessed is he who seizes your little ones and dashes them against the rock!
Psalms 138:1 Lord, you put me to the test, and I know that you know me.
Psalms 138:2 You know when I sit down, and when I stand up;
Psalms 138:3 You read my thoughts from afar.
Psalms 138:4 You have surveyed my path and my journey;
Psalms 138:5 and you have foreseen all my ways.
Psalms 138:6 Because before the words come out of my mouth, you know them completely, Lord.
Psalms 138:7 You formed me from the very beginning, and you have always been present.
Psalms 138:8 This is a great wonder to me;
Psalms 138:9 it is so powerful, and I can't begin to comprehend it.
Psalms 138:10 Where can I go to escape your spirit? Where can I flee from your face?
Psalms 138:11 If I ascend into the sky, you are there;
Psalms 138:12 if I go down to hell, you are there.
Psalms 138:13 If I fly to the ends of the earth and take wings in the morning,
Psalms 138:14 even there your hand will lead me, and your right hand will hold me.
Psalms 138:15 And I said, "Surely darkness will conceal me;"
Psalms 138:16 and night will be my light in my pleasure.
Psalms 138:17 Even darkness isn't dark to you, and night is as bright as the day: both the darkness and the light are the same to you.
Psalms 138:18 For you have made me;
Psalms 138:19 you have received me in my mother's womb.
Psalms 138:20 I will praise you, because you are a wonderful, amazing God;
Psalms 138:21 your works are miraculous, and my soul knows this well.
Psalms 138:22 My body was not hidden from you when I was being formed secretly;
Psalms 138:23 and all parts of my body were being made in the depths of the earth.
Psalms 138:24 Your eyes saw my imperfection, and in your book all things were written;
Psalms 138:25 the days of my life have been formed, and not one of them is without you.
Psalms 138:26 And how precious to me are your friends, O God! How powerful are their leaders!
Psalms 138:27 I will count them, and they will increase more than the sand: if I rise up, I am still with you.
Psalms 138:28 If you slay the wicked, God, men of bloodshed, get away from me:
Psalms 138:29 because they speak deceitfully and take your cities in vain.
Psalms 138:30 Do I not hate those who hate you, Lord? Am I not grieved for your enemies?
Psalms 138:31 I hated them with perfect hatred: they have become my enemies.
Psalms 138:32 Examine me, God, and know my heart; test me, and know my ways.
Psalms 138:33 And see if there is any path of wickedness in me: and lead me in the way everlasting.
Psalms 139:1 O Lord, you have examined me, and you have known me.
Psalms 139:2 You know my sitting and my rising.
Psalms 139:3 You have understood my thoughts from afar.
Psalms 139:4 You have investigated my path, and my measuring cord.
Psalms 139:5 And you have seen all my ways. Because there is no word in my tongue.
Psalms 139:6 Behold, O Lord, you have known all things new and old.
Psalms 139:7 You have made me, and put your hand upon me.
Psalms 139:8 Your knowledge has become wonderful and mysterious, and I cannot attain it.
Psalms 139:9 Where shall I go from your Spirit? Or where shall I flee from your face?
Psalms 139:10 If I go up into the sky, you are there. If I go down into the underworld, you are there.
Psalms 139:11 If I take my wings in the morning, and dwell in the farthest parts of the sea,
Psalms 139:12 Even there your hand will lead me, and your right hand will hold me.
Psalms 139:13 And if I say: Perhaps the darkness will overwhelm me: and night will be my illumination in my delights:
Psalms 139:14 Even the darkness will not be hidden from you, and night will be illuminated like day. As is its darkness, so is its light.
Psalms 139:15 For you have possessed my kidneys: you have taken me from my mother's womb.
Psalms 139:16 I will give you praise: because you have been fearfully magnified. Wonderful are your works, and my soul knows this exceedingly well.
Psalms 139:17 My bone was not hidden from you, that you have made in secret: and my substance in the lower parts of the earth.
Psalms 139:18 Your eyes have seen my imperfection, and in your book all are written: days will be formed, and there will be none among them.
Psalms 139:19 But to me, your friends are greatly honored, O God: their leadership is greatly strengthened.
Psalms 139:20 I will count them, and they will be multiplied above the sand: I have risen, and I am still with you.
Psalms 139:21 If, O God, you will kill the sinners: men of blood, seek blood from me.
Psalms 139:22 Who say in thought: We will take your cities in vain.
Psalms 139:23 Do I not hate those who hate you, O Lord? And do I not waste away because of your enemies?
Psalms 139:24 I hated them with a perfect hatred: they have become my enemies.
Psalms 139:25 Test me, O God, and know my heart: question me, and know my ways.
Psalms 139:26 And see if the way of iniquity is in me: and lead me in the way everlasting.
Psalms 140:1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
Psalms 140:2 Lord, I cried to you. Hear me. Pay attention to my voice when I cry out to you.
Psalms 140:3 May my prayer rise before you like incense. May my hands lifted up be a sacrifice in the evening.
Psalms 140:4 O Lord, set a guard over my mouth. And keep watch at the door of my lips.
Psalms 140:5 Do not turn my heart to the words of evil. Do not let me make excuses for my sins.
Psalms 140:6 Do not let me make excuses with those who do evil, nor should I befriend those who are evil.
Psalms 140:7 Let the righteous correct me with mercy, and rebuke me. But the oil of a sinner should not make my head fat.
Psalms 140:8 Because my prayer is always their will. Their judges are completely destroyed by their sins.
Psalms 140:9 They will hear my words and understand that they could not resist my prayer, as the very earth cracked open. Their bones are scattered according to the grave.
Psalms 140:10 Because my eyes are turned towards you, O Lord. I have put my trust in you. Do not take away my soul.
Psalms 140:11 Keep me from the trap they have set for me, and from the snares of those who do evil.
Psalms 140:12 The wicked will fall into their own net. Meanwhile, I am alone until I pass through their traps.
Psalms 141:1 Lord, I am calling to You. Answer me. Listen to my voice as I call to You.
Psalms 141:2 Let my prayer be as incense in Your sight, and the lifting up of my hands be as the evening sacrifice.
Psalms 141:3 Set a guard, Lord, over my mouth, and a door to enclose my lips.
Psalms 141:4 Do not incline my heart to words of evil or to the making of excuses for sin.
Psalms 141:5 Let me not take part in the works of the evildoers. May I not be numbered among them.
Psalms 141:6 The just man will strike me with mercy and will rebuke me. But the oil of the sinner will not anoint my head.
Psalms 141:7 For even in their evil prayers, their judges have been swallowed up in the rock.
Psalms 141:8 My words are heard for they have prevailed. Like the earth, they are upon the earth. Their bones are scattered near hell.
Psalms 141:9 For my eyes are turned to You, Lord. I have hoped in You, do not take away my soul.
Psalms 141:10 Keep me from the snare that they have laid for me, and from the snares of those who do evil.
Psalms 141:11 The sinners will fall in the net that they made for themselves. I will be alone until I pass by.
Psalms 142:1 A Psalm of David. Lord, hear my prayer; listen to my plea, and fulfill it. Respond to my prayer in truth, and hear my plea in your justice.
Psalms 142:2 Do not enter into judgment with your servant, because no living thing will be just by your standards.
Psalms 142:3 My enemy has hounded my soul and humiliated my life in this world.
Psalms 142:4 I am placed in the darkness, among those in the grave. My spirit is anxious, my heart is troubled.
Psalms 142:5 I recall the days of old, I reflect on all your works, and I meditate on what your hands have made.
Psalms 142:6 I stretch out my hands to you; my soul is like a barren land yearning for you.
Psalms 142:7 Answer me quickly, Lord; my spirit fails.
Psalms 142:8 Do not turn your face away from me, lest I be like those who go down to the pit.
Psalms 142:9 Let me hear your kindness in the morning, for I trust in you.
Psalms 142:10 Show me the way I should go, for I lift up my soul to you.
Psalms 142:11 Rescue me from my enemies, Lord; I flee to you for refuge.
Psalms 142:12 Teach me to do your will, for you are my God.
Psalms 142:13 Your good Spirit will lead me on the right path; for the sake of your name, revive me.
Psalms 142:14 In your justice, bring my soul out of trouble.
Psalms 142:15 In your mercy, destroy my enemies and destroy all who harass my soul, for I am your servant.
Psalms 143:1 A psalm of David. Lord, listen to my prayer. Hear my plea in your truth. Listen to me in your righteousness.
Psalms 143:2 Do not punish me with a judgment because no person can be made just by God.
Psalms 143:3 The enemy has hunted my soul, and has crushed my life.
Psalms 143:4 He has put me into darkness, like those who are in the grave. My spirit has grown faint. My heart is troubled within me.
Psalms 143:5 I remember the ancient days; I reflect on all your works, and I meditate on your achievements.
Psalms 143:6 I stretch out my hands to you; my soul is like land that thirsts for your presence.
Psalms 143:7 Answer me quickly, Lord. My spirit fails. Do not turn your face away from me, or I will be like those who go down into the pit.
Psalms 143:8 Let me hear of your loving kindness in the morning because I put my trust in you. Show me the way I should go, because to you I lift up my soul.
Psalms 143:9 Deliver me from my enemies, Lord, because I run to you for help. Teach me to do your will because you are my God.
Psalms 143:10 Let your good Spirit lead me into a land of uprightness, and for your name’s sake, give me life.
Psalms 143:11 In your righteousness bring my soul out of trouble. Destroy my enemies in your mercy.
Psalms 143:12 Destroy all those who torment my soul because I am your servant.
Psalms 144:1 I will exalt you, my God, the King, and I will bless your name for all time and forever.
Psalms 144:2 Every day I will bless you, and I will praise your name for all time and forever.
Psalms 144:3 Great is the Lord, and exceedingly praiseworthy, and there is no end to his greatness.
Psalms 144:4 Generation after generation will praise your works, and will announce your power.
Psalms 144:5 They will speak of the magnificence of the glory of your holiness, and they will tell of your wonders.
Psalms 144:6 They will speak of the power of your awesome deeds, and they will narrate your greatness.
Psalms 144:7 They will pour forth the memory of your abundant sweetness and will rejoice in your justice.
Psalms 144:8 The Lord is merciful and compassionate, patient, and of great mercy.
Psalms 144:9 The Lord is good to all, and his mercies are over all his works.
Psalms 144:10 May all your works give thanks to you, O Lord, and may your holy ones bless you.
Psalms 144:11 They will speak of the glory of your kingdom, and they will talk of your power:
Psalms 144:12 so that they may make known to the sons of men your power and the glory of the beauty of your kingdom.
Psalms 144:13 Your kingdom is the kingdom of all ages, and your dominion is in every generation.
Psalms 144:14 The Lord is faithful in all his words, and holy in all his works.
Psalms 144:15 The Lord strengthens all who are falling, and raises up all who are bowed down.
Psalms 144:16 The eyes of all hope in you, O Lord, and you give them food in due season.
Psalms 144:17 You open your hand and fill every living thing with blessing.
Psalms 144:18 The Lord is just in all his ways, and holy in all his works.
Psalms 144:19 The Lord is near to all who call upon him, to all who call upon him in truth.
Psalms 144:20 He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him, and he will hear their prayer and save them.
Psalms 144:21 The Lord protects all who love him, but he will destroy all the wicked.
Psalms 144:22 My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord, and let all flesh bless his holy name for all time and forever.

Psalms 146:1 Praise God, because He is good! Sing to our God, because He is full of joy.
Psalms 146:2 God is the one who builds Jerusalem; He will gather all the scattered people of Israel.
Psalms 146:3 He heals those whose hearts are broken, and He binds up their wounds.
Psalms 146:4 He knows the number of the stars and calls each of them by name.
Psalms 146:5 Our Lord is great, and His power is great, and there is no limit to His wisdom.
Psalms 146:6 God supports the gentle. But He humbles sinners down to the earth.
Psalms 146:7 Sing to God, giving thanks; sing to our God with a harp.
Psalms 146:8 He covers the sky with clouds, and He prepares rain for the earth. He makes grass grow on the mountains, and crops for the service of men.
Psalms 146:9 He gives food to the cattle, and to the young ravens when they call to Him.
Psalms 146:10 He does not delight in the strength of the horse, nor does He take pleasure in the legs of a man.
Psalms 146:11 God takes pleasure in those who fear Him, and in those who hope in His mercy.
Psalms 146:12 Praise the Lord, Jerusalem! Praise your God, Zion!
Psalms 146:13 Because He has strengthened the locks of your gates; He has blessed your children within you.
Psalms 146:14 He makes peace in your borders and fills you with the finest wheat.
Psalms 146:15 He sends out His word to the earth; quickly runs His word.
Psalms 146:16 He gives snow like wool, scatters the mist like ashes.
Psalms 146:17 He sends His ice like crumbs; who can stand against His cold?
Psalms 146:18 He sends out His word and melts them; He blows His spirit, and the waters flow.
Psalms 146:19 He declares His word to Jacob, His justice and judgements to Israel.
Psalms 146:20 He has not done this for every nation, and He has not revealed His judgements to them.

Psalms 147:2 God rebuilds Jerusalem; He gathers the scattered people of Israel.
Psalms 147:3 He heals those with broken hearts, and binds up their wounds.
Psalms 147:4 He determines the number of the stars and calls each of them by their name.
Psalms 147:5 Great is our God, and His power is great; His wisdom has no limit.
Psalms 147:6 God helps the poor, but He humbles the wicked and the proud.
Psalms 147:7 Sing to God with thanksgiving, and sing to our God with the harp.
Psalms 147:8 He covers the sky with clouds, provides the rain for the land, makes the grass grow in the mountains, and herbs for human use.
Psalms 147:9 He gives food to the cattle and the young ravens when they call to Him.
Psalms 147:10 He doesn’t take pleasure in the strength of a horse or the speed of a man.
Psalms 147:11 God takes pleasure in those who fear Him and those who hope in His mercy.
Psalms 147:12 Praise God, Jerusalem; Praise your God, Zion.
Psalms 147:13 He strengthens the gates of your city and blesses your children.
Psalms 147:14 He makes peace in your land, and fills you with the finest wheat.
Psalms 147:15 He sends out His word to the earth and His word runs swiftly.
Psalms 147:16 He gives snow like wool; He scatters frost like ashes.
Psalms 147:17 He throws down ice in pieces; who can endure His cold?
Psalms 147:18 He sends out His word, and melts the ice, and when His wind blows, the waters flow.
Psalms 147:19 He proclaims His word to Jacob, His laws and judgments to Israel.
Psalms 147:20 He has not done this for any other nation, and has not revealed His judgments to them. Praise God.

Psalms 148:4 Praise him, highest sky of the heavens! And you waters above the sky, praise the name of God.
Psalms 148:5 Because he spoke, and it was made. He commanded, and everything was created.

Psalms 148:8 Fire, hail, snow, ice, storm winds, all obeying his word:

Psalms 149:3 Let them praise his name with dancing, and in musical accompaniment, they shall sing to him.
Psalms 149:4 For God is pleased by his people. He will exalt the humble with salvation.
Psalms 149:5 The saints will exult in glory, and will rejoice on their beds.
Psalms 149:6 Let the praise of God be in their throats, and let them carry the two-edged swords in their hands.
Psalms 149:7 This is to bring vengeance on the nations and punishments on the peoples.
Psalms 149:8 To bind their kings in chains and their nobles in iron shackles.
Psalms 149:9 This is the judgment written for them, and it is the glory that comes to all the saints.
Psalms 150:1 Praise God in his holy place! Praise him in the great universe He created and rules.
Psalms 150:2 Praise Him for the many things He can do! Praise Him because of how great He is!

Proverbs 1:1 These are the proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel:
Proverbs 1:2 Their purpose is to teach wisdom and discipline;
Proverbs 1:3 To help you understand the words of the wise;
Proverbs 1:4 To help you receive training in doctrine, justice, judgment, and equity;
Proverbs 1:5 So that children may be prudent, and the young may have knowledge and understanding.
Proverbs 1:6 The wise will listen, and become wiser; and those who understand will guide themselves well.
Proverbs 1:7 The fear of God is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and doctrine.
Proverbs 1:8 Listen, my son, to the discipline of your father, and don't abandon the law of your mother:
Proverbs 1:9 For these teachings will be a graceful ornament for your head, and a chain for your neck.
Proverbs 1:10 My son, if sinners entice you, do not consent.
Proverbs 1:11 If they say, “Come with us, let us lay in wait for blood, let us hide snares against the innocent without cause:
Proverbs 1:12 Let us swallow him up alive like hell, and the just as if he were going down into a pit:
Proverbs 1:13 We shall find all precious substance, we will fill our houses with spoils:
Proverbs 1:14 Cast in your lot among us, and let us all have one purse:
Proverbs 1:15 My son, do not walk with them, restrain your foot from their paths:
Proverbs 1:16 For their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed blood.
Proverbs 1:17 But in vain the net is spread before the eyes of those who have wings.
Proverbs 1:18 For they lie in wait against their own blood, and practice deceits against their own souls.
Proverbs 1:19 So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain: they take away the souls of their possessors.
Proverbs 1:20 Wisdom cries out in the streets, she utters her voice in the squares:
Proverbs 1:21 At the head of crowds she cries out, in the entrance of the gates she speaks:
Proverbs 1:22 How long, O little ones, will you love childhood, and you fools desire what is hurtful to you?
Proverbs 1:23 Turn to my reproof; behold, I will pour out my spirit to you, and I will show you my words.
Proverbs 1:24 Because I have called, and you refused: I have stretched out my hand, and there was no one who would listen:
Proverbs 1:25 But you have treated all my counsel as nothing, and have neglected my reproofs:
Proverbs 1:26 I also will laugh at your destruction: and I will mock when what you feared comes upon you,
Proverbs 1:27 When sudden calamity falls upon you, and destruction comes like a storm: when tribulation and anguish come upon you.
Proverbs 1:28 Then they will call upon me, and I will not hear: they will rise early in the morning, and they will not find me:
Proverbs 1:29 Because they have despised knowledge, and have not chosen the fear of God:
Proverbs 1:30 Nor have they willed my counsel, and have scorned my reproofs:
Proverbs 1:31 Therefore they shall eat of the fruit of their own way, and they shall be filled with their own devices.
Proverbs 1:32 The turning away of the little ones will kill them, and the prosperity of fools will deceive them.
Proverbs 1:33 But whoever believes in me, shall rest in hope, and shall abound with the fear of God.
Proverbs 2:1 My son, if you receive my words and treasure my precepts,
Proverbs 2:2 Then you will train your heart to understand, and turn your ear to wisdom.
Proverbs 2:3 Yes, if you ask to understand, and if you direct your heart to discern wisdom—
Proverbs 2:4 If you seek her like silver, and search for her like a treasure—
Proverbs 2:5 Then you will understand the fear of the Lord, and you will find the knowledge of God.
Proverbs 2:6 For the Lord gives wisdom, and from His mouth comes understanding and insight.
Proverbs 2:7 He treasures the honest. He protects the way of those who live blamelessly,
Proverbs 2:8 preserving the paths of justice, and safeguarding the ways of the saints.
Proverbs 2:9 Then you will understand justice and judgment and fairness, and every good path.
Proverbs 2:10 If wisdom enters your heart, and knowledge delights your soul,
Proverbs 2:11 Then counsel will protect you, and prudence will preserve you:
Proverbs 2:12 to rescue you from the evil way, and from the man who speaks perverse things:
Proverbs 2:13 those who abandon the straight path, and walk the dark paths:
Proverbs 2:14 who rejoice when they do evil, and exult in the worst things:
Proverbs 2:15 whose paths are crooked, and whose steps are twisted.
Proverbs 2:16 And to deliver you from a strange woman, and from the foreigner who makes her words sweet:
Proverbs 2:17 who abandons the husband of her youth and has forgotten the covenant of her God.
Proverbs 2:18 For her house is near death, and her paths lead to the underworld.
Proverbs 2:19 All who enter her do not return, and do not sustain the right paths.
Proverbs 2:20 So that a just man walks in his integrity: his steps are clear for one who walks the right way.
Proverbs 2:21 For the upright shall inhabit the land, and the perfect will remain in it.
Proverbs 2:22 But the wicked will be cut off from the earth: and those who deal unjustly will be removed from it.
Proverbs 3:1 My son, don't forget my teachings, and let your heart guard my commandments.
Proverbs 3:2 They will add to you long life, many years, and peace.
Proverbs 3:3 Never forsake kindness and truth, but tie them around your neck, and write them on the tablets of your heart.
Proverbs 3:4 Then you will find favor and good understanding in the sight of God and of men.
Proverbs 3:5 Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not rely on your own understanding.
Proverbs 3:6 In all your ways, give thought to Him, and He will direct your steps.
Proverbs 3:7 Don’t think you are wise in your own eyes; fear the Lord, and turn away from evil.
Proverbs 3:8 This will be health for your navel, and nourishment for your bones.
Proverbs 3:9 Honor the Lord with your possessions, and give Him the first fruits of your crops.
Proverbs 3:10 Then your barns will be filled to overflowing, and your vats will overflow with wine.
Proverbs 3:11 My son, do not reject the Lord’s discipline, nor be disgusted when you are corrected by Him:
Proverbs 3:12 because the Lord corrects the one He loves, as a father corrects the son in whom he delights.
Proverbs 3:13 Happy is the man who finds wisdom, and the man who overflows with understanding:
Proverbs 3:14 For her profit is better than the profit of silver, and her revenue is better than fine gold.
Proverbs 3:15 She is more precious than all gems, and nothing you desire can compare to her.
Proverbs 3:16 Long life is in her right hand, and in her left hand are riches and honor.
Proverbs 3:17 Her ways are pleasant ways, and all her paths are peace.
Proverbs 3:18 She is a tree of life to those who grasp her, and happy is the one who holds her fast.
Proverbs 3:19 The Lord by wisdom founded the earth, and by understanding He established the heavens.
Proverbs 3:20 By His knowledge the depths were broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.
Proverbs 3:21 My son, let these things not depart from your sight: keep sound wisdom and discretion.
Proverbs 3:22 So they will be life for your soul and grace for your neck.
Proverbs 3:23 Then you will go your way confidently, and your foot will not stumble.
Proverbs 3:24 If you lie down, you will not be afraid; when you sleep, your sleep will be sweet.
Proverbs 3:25 Do not be afraid of sudden fear, nor of the ruin of the wicked when it comes.
Proverbs 3:26 For the Lord will be your confidence, and will keep your foot from being caught.
Proverbs 3:27 Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in your power to do it.
Proverbs 3:28 Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come back, and tomorrow I will give it,” when you have it with you.
Proverbs 3:29 Do not plan evil against your neighbor, when he trusts in you.
Proverbs 3:30 Do not quarrel with a man without cause, if he has done you no harm.
Proverbs 3:31 Do not envy the man of violence, nor choose any of his ways:
Proverbs 3:32 because the perverse man is an abomination to the Lord, but He is intimate with the upright.
Proverbs 3:33 The Lord’s curse is on the house of the wicked, but He blesses the dwelling of the just.
Proverbs 3:34 Truly, He mocks at the scornful, but gives grace to the humble.
Proverbs 3:35 The wise will inherit glory, but fools will receive disgrace.
Proverbs 4:1 Listen, sons, to the teachings of your father, and pay attention so you may understand wisdom.
Proverbs 4:2 I will give you good teaching: don't abandon my law.
Proverbs 4:3 I was a son of my father, gentle and beloved in the eyes of my mother.
Proverbs 4:4 And he taught me, and said to me: “Keep my words in your heart, guard my precepts, and live by them.”
Proverbs 4:5 Get wisdom, get understanding: don't forget, and don't turn away from the words of my mouth.
Proverbs 4:6 Don't abandon her, and she will guard you; love her, and she will protect you.
Proverbs 4:7 The beginning of wisdom is, get wisdom, and with all your possessions, acquire understanding.
Proverbs 4:8 Embrace her, and she will exalt you; you will be glorified by her, when you have embraced her.
Proverbs 4:9 She will give your head the grace of growth, and she will crown you with glory.
Proverbs 4:10 Listen, my son, and accept my words, and the years of your life will multiply for you.
Proverbs 4:11 I will show you the path of wisdom, and I will lead you in the footsteps of righteousness:
Proverbs 4:12 when you enter it, your steps will not be constricted; and when you run, you will not have sadness.
Proverbs 4:13 Take discipline, do not abandon it; guard it, because it is your life.
Proverbs 4:14 Don't enter the path of the wicked, nor tread the way of sinners.
Proverbs 4:15 Avoid it, and do not pass through it; turn away, and depart from it.
Proverbs 4:16 For they do not sleep unless they have done evil: and their sleep is taken away unless they have tripped someone.
Proverbs 4:17 For they eat the bread of ungodliness, and they drink the wine of iniquity.
Proverbs 4:18 But the path of the just is like light traveling through space, and it will be made just until the perfect day.
Proverbs 4:19 The way of the wicked is dark: they do not know where they fall.
Proverbs 4:20 My son, pay attention to my words: and incline your ear to my sayings.
Proverbs 4:21 Let them not depart from your eyes: guard them in the middle of your heart.
Proverbs 4:22 For they are life to those who find them: and health to all flesh.
Proverbs 4:23 Keep watch over your heart with every care: because from it, the ways of life come forth.
Proverbs 4:24 Remove from you a perverse mouth, and put lying lips far from you.
Proverbs 4:25 Let your eyes look straight ahead, and let your eyelids direct your steps.
Proverbs 4:26 Direct your steps, and make all your ways firm.
Proverbs 4:27 Do not turn to the right or to the left: turn your foot away from evil.
Proverbs 5:1 My son, pay attention to my wisdom. Give ear to my understanding.
Proverbs 5:2 Keep discretion, and your lips will guard knowledge.
Proverbs 5:3 Don't long for a woman who isn't your wife, and don't wander around her house.
Proverbs 5:4 For the lips of a harlot are like a dripping honeycomb, and her throat is smoother than oil.
Proverbs 5:5 But in the end, she is as bitter as wormwood, and sharp as a two-edged sword.
Proverbs 5:6 Her feet go down to death, and her steps lead straight to the grave.
Proverbs 5:7 She doesn't walk the paths of life. Her steps are always wandering, and you can't predict where she will go.
Proverbs 5:8 Now, my son, listen to me and don't turn away from the words I am saying.
Proverbs 5:9 Keep your way far from her, and don't go near the door of her house.
Proverbs 5:10 Lest you should give your honor to others, and your years to those who are cruel.
Proverbs 5:11 Lest strangers be filled with your strength, and your labors in the house of someone else,
Proverbs 5:12 And in the end you will regret it, when you've ruined your flesh and your body, and say:
Proverbs 5:13 “How I hated discipline, and my heart scorned rebuke!
Proverbs 5:14 I didn’t listen to the voice of those who taught me, nor did I pay attention to those who gave me instruction.
Proverbs 5:15 I almost fell into every kind of evil in the middle of the Church and the synagogues.
Proverbs 5:16 Drink water from your own cistern, and from the springs of your well.
Proverbs 5:17 Let your springs be poured out outside, but divide your waters into the streets.
Proverbs 5:18 Let them be yours alone, and not those of strangers with you.
Proverbs 5:19 Let your fountain be blessed, and rejoice with the wife of your youth.
Proverbs 5:20 A most beautiful hind, and a graceful deer. Let her breasts satisfy you at all times; always delight in her love.
Proverbs 5:21 Why, my son, should you be ruined with a woman who isn’t your wife, and be embraced in the bosom of another?
Proverbs 5:22 The works of a man are in the sight of the Lord, and He considers his ways.
Proverbs 5:23 The wicked are caught in their own sins, and are held fast in the chains of their own offenses.
Proverbs 6:1 My son, if you have agreed to be surety for your neighbor, and have pledged your word for another,
Proverbs 6:2 you are ensnared by the words of your mouth, and taken captive by the words of your lips,
Proverbs 6:3 do what I say, my son, and deliver yourself; because you have fallen into the hands of your neighbor: hasten and withdraw.
Proverbs 6:4 Give not sleep to your eyes, nor slumber to your eyelids.
Proverbs 6:5 Be delivered as a roe from the hand, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
Proverbs 6:6 Go to the ant, O sluggard, and consider her ways, and learn wisdom.
Proverbs 6:7 Which although she has no guide, nor master, nor lord,
Proverbs 6:8 provides her food in the summer, and gathers in the harvest what she may eat.
Proverbs 6:9 How long, you sluggard, will you sleep? When will you arise from your sleep?
Proverbs 6:10 A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest:
Proverbs 6:11 and your poverty shall come as a traveler, and your want as an armed man.
Proverbs 6:12 A wicked man, a man without law, walks with a perverse mouth.
Proverbs 6:13 Who winks with his eyes, and presses with his feet, and speaks with his finger.
Proverbs 6:14 Perversities are in his heart, he devises evil at all times, and sows discord.
Proverbs 6:15 Therefore his destruction shall come suddenly; he shall be broken suddenly, and shall no longer have a remedy.
Proverbs 6:16 These six things the Lord hates, and the seventh his soul hates:
Proverbs 6:17 Haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood,
Proverbs 6:18 a heart that devises wicked plots, feet swift to run into evil,
Proverbs 6:19 a false witness that utters lies, and he that sows discord among brothers.
Proverbs 6:20 Keep, my son, the precepts of your father, and forsake not the law of your mother:
Proverbs 6:21 Bind them continually in your heart, and put them around your neck.
Proverbs 6:22 When you walk, let them go with you; when you sleep, let them keep you; and when you wake, speak with them.
Proverbs 6:23 Because the commandment is a lamp, and the law a light, and the way of life is the reproof of discipline:
Proverbs 6:24 That you may keep yourself from the evil woman, and from the flattery of the tongue of the stranger.
Proverbs 6:25 Desire not her beauty in your heart, neither be caught with her eyelids.
Proverbs 6:26 For a harlot's sustenance is to the morsel of bread: and the strange woman hunts for the precious soul.
Proverbs 6:27 Can a man hide fire in his bosom, and his garments not be burned?
Proverbs 6:28 Or who can walk upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?
Proverbs 6:29 So is he that goes in to his neighbor's wife; he shall not be clean that touches her.
Proverbs 6:30 It is no fault in him that steals when he is hungry, that he may fill his soul.
Proverbs 6:31 But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold, and shall give all the substance of his house.
Proverbs 6:32 He that commits adultery is foolish: but he that would destroy his own soul does it.
Proverbs 6:33 He gathers to himself disgrace and infamy, and his shame shall not be blotted out.
Proverbs 6:34 For the jealousy of a husband provokes wrath: nor will he spare in the day of revenge.
Proverbs 6:35 Nor will he accept any man's prayers, nor will he be appeased by any amount of compensation.
Proverbs 7:1 My son, always remember and guard what I teach you. Always keep in your heart the wisdom I give you.
Proverbs 7:2 Keep my commands, and you will live. Treasure my law like the pupil of your eye.
Proverbs 7:3 Tie my wisdom to your fingers to remind you. Write it on the tablets of your heart.
Proverbs 7:4 Say to wisdom: “You are my sister.” Call prudence your closest friend:
Proverbs 7:5 So that they will guard you against a strange woman. Against the one who flatters with her words.
Proverbs 7:6 Once I looked out the window of my house. I peered through the lattice,
Proverbs 7:7 And I saw some naive young men. I noticed a young man with no common sense among them.
Proverbs 7:8 He was going down the street near her corner. He was walking near the door of her house,
Proverbs 7:9 in the twilight, as it was getting dark, in the middle of the night,
Proverbs 7:10 Suddenly, a woman came to meet him. She was dressed like a prostitute, ready to deceive the hearts of fools.
Proverbs 7:11 She was loud and defiant. Her feet never stayed in one place.
Proverbs 7:12 She was now in the streets, now in the squares, now near every corner, lurking near the road.
Proverbs 7:13 She grabbed him and kissed him. She then said to him with a brazen face:
Proverbs 7:14 “I had to offer sacrifices for my safety. Today, I have paid my vows.
Proverbs 7:15 So I came out to meet you. I wanted you, and I found you!
Proverbs 7:16 I have spread my bed with tapestries, with fine linens from Egypt.
Proverbs 7:17 I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Proverbs 7:18 Come, let's drink our fill of love, and enjoy each other's company until morning. My husband isn’t home,
Proverbs 7:19 He has gone on a long journey.
Proverbs 7:20 He took a bag of money with him. He will return home on the appointed day.”
Proverbs 7:21 With her seductive words, she persuaded him. She enticed him with her flattering lips.
Proverbs 7:22 Immediately he followed her like an ox to the slaughter, like a fool going to be punished, not knowing that he was going to be punished,
Proverbs 7:23 until an arrow pierces his liver. Like a bird darting into a snare, unaware that it’s a matter of life and death.
Proverbs 7:24 Now, my son, listen to me and pay attention to the words of my mouth.
Proverbs 7:25 Do not let your heart turn to her ways, and do not stray on her paths.
Proverbs 7:26 Because she has caused many to be wounded and killed. She has killed many of the strongest men.
Proverbs 7:27 Her house is the way to the grave; it descends to the chambers of death.
Proverbs 8:1 Doesn't wisdom cry out? Doesn't careful thought raise its voice?
Proverbs 8:2 Wisdom stands in the highest places, in the middle of the public roads,
Proverbs 8:3 near the city gates, and it is the first thing people hear.
Proverbs 8:4 “I call out to you, men. My voice is for all people.
Proverbs 8:5 You who are foolish, learn common sense. You who are simple, apply your minds.
Proverbs 8:6 Listen, because I will speak of great things. I will open my lips to say what is right.
Proverbs 8:7 My mouth will proclaim truth. My lips hate wicked speech.
Proverbs 8:8 All my words are just. There is nothing twisted or wrong in them.
Proverbs 8:9 Everything is clear to those who understand, and truth will come to those who know.
Proverbs 8:10 Accept my instruction, not money; and knowledge more than the purest gold.
Proverbs 8:11 For wisdom is better than jewels, and nothing desired is comparable to it.
Proverbs 8:12 “I, Wisdom, dwell in counsel. I am present in thoughtful consideration.
Proverbs 8:13 To fear the Lord is to hate evil. I hate pride, arrogance, a bad path, and a deceitful mouth.
Proverbs 8:14 I have counsel and righteousness. I have prudence, I have strength.
Proverbs 8:15 By me, kings reign, and rulers decree what is just.
Proverbs 8:16 Through me, princes command, and the powerful decree justice.
Proverbs 8:17 I love those who love me. Those who seek me early will find me.
Proverbs 8:18 Riches and glory are with me, as are wealth and righteousness.
Proverbs 8:19 My fruit is better than gold and precious stones; and my produce is better than refined silver.
Proverbs 8:20 I walk in the way of righteousness, in the middle of the paths of judgment.
Proverbs 8:21 So that I may enrich those who love me and fill their treasuries.
Proverbs 8:22 The Lord created me at the beginning of His ways, before He made anything else.
Proverbs 8:23 From eternity, I was ordained, from the beginning, before the earth was made.
Proverbs 8:24 Before there were deep seas, I was already conceived; before the springs of water flowed forth:
Proverbs 8:25 Before the mountains were formed, I was born before the hills.
Proverbs 8:26 Before He had made the land, the rivers, and the foundations of the earth, I was there.
Proverbs 8:27 When He prepared the universe, I was there; when He established the sky above the oceans,
Proverbs 8:28 when He strengthened the clouds above, and secured the fountains of the deep,
Proverbs 8:29 when He established the sea's boundaries, and a law so the water wouldn't cross them, and when He laid the foundations of the earth,
Proverbs 8:30 then I was with Him, arranging everything. And I rejoiced daily, playing before Him all the time,
Proverbs 8:31 playing in the world; and my delight was to be with the children of men.
Proverbs 8:32 So now, children, listen to me: blessed are those who keep my ways.
Proverbs 8:33 Listen to instruction and be wise; do not cast it away.
Proverbs 8:34 Blessed is the man who hears me, and who watches at my doors every day, and observes the posts of my doors.
Proverbs 8:35 Whoever finds me finds life and will receive salvation from the Lord.
Proverbs 8:36 But whoever sins against me harms his own soul. All who hate me love death.
Proverbs 9:1 Wisdom has built herself a house; she has carved out seven columns.
Proverbs 9:2 She has prepared her sacrifices, mixed her wine, and set up her table.
Proverbs 9:3 She sent her servants to call out from the highest points and the walls of the city:
Proverbs 9:4 "Whoever is young, let him come to me," and she spoke to those who lacked understanding:
Proverbs 9:5 "Come, eat my bread, and drink the wine I have mixed for you:
Proverbs 9:6 Abandon your ignorance, and you will live, and walk in the path of prudence."
Proverbs 9:7 He who instructs a scoffer harms himself; he who reproves the wicked brings shame upon himself.
Proverbs 9:8 Do not reprove a scoffer, lest he hate you; reprove a wise man, and he will love you.
Proverbs 9:9 Give an opportunity to a wise man, and wisdom will be added to him; teach a just man, and he will increase in his learning.
Proverbs 9:10 Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the saints is prudence.
Proverbs 9:11 Through me, your days will be multiplied, and years of life will be added to you.
Proverbs 9:12 If you are wise, you are wise for yourself; if you are a scoffer, you alone will bear the evil.
Proverbs 9:13 Folly is a loud, foolish woman, knowing nothing.
Proverbs 9:14 She sits at the doors of her house, on a seat, in the high places of the city,
Proverbs 9:15 to call out to those passing by on the road, who go on their way:
Proverbs 9:16 "Whoever is young, let him come to me;" and she spoke to the foolish:
Proverbs 9:17 “Stolen water is sweeter, and hidden bread is more pleasant."
Proverbs 9:18 But she does not know that the dead are there, and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
Proverbs 10:1 Proverbs of Solomon. A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish son is the sadness of his mother.
Proverbs 10:2 Treasures gained through evil will not last, but righteousness delivers from death.
Proverbs 10:3 The Lord will not let the just go hungry, but He sends away the desires of the wicked.
Proverbs 10:4 A lazy hand makes a man poor, but the hand of the diligent brings wealth.
Proverbs 10:5 He who gathers in the harvest is a wise son, but he who sleeps during the harvest is a shameful son.
Proverbs 10:6 Blessings are on the head of the just, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
Proverbs 10:7 The memory of the just is blessed, but the name of the wicked rots.
Proverbs 10:8 The wise of heart receives the commandments, but a fool will be ruined by his own mouth.
Proverbs 10:9 He who walks uprightly walks securely, but he who perverts his ways will be exposed.
Proverbs 10:10 He who winks with his eye causes grief, and a fool will chatter foolishly.
Proverbs 10:11 The mouth of the just is a fountain of life, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
Proverbs 10:12 Hatred stirs up disputes, and the fool reveals all that he does not want covered.
Proverbs 10:13 On the lips of the wise is found wisdom, and a rod is on the back of him who lacks heart.
Proverbs 10:14 The wise hides knowledge, but the mouth of the fool is near to ruin.
Proverbs 10:15 The wealth of the rich is their strong city, but the fear of the poor is their ruin.
Proverbs 10:16 The work of the just leads to life, but the teachings of the wicked lead to sin.
Proverbs 10:17 The path of life is for those who keep discipline, but he who abandons reproof errs.
Proverbs 10:18 He who conceals hatred is a liar with his lips, and he who spreads slander is a fool.
Proverbs 10:19 In much talk, sin will not be absent, but he who restrains his lips is most prudent.
Proverbs 10:20 The tongue of the just is choice silver, but the heart of the wicked is of little value.
Proverbs 10:21 The lips of the just feed many, but fools are grieved by their own folly.
Proverbs 10:22 The blessing of the Lord makes rich, and He adds no sorrow with it.
Proverbs 10:23 Doing wickedness is like sport to a fool, but wisdom is joy to a man of understanding.
Proverbs 10:24 What the wicked fears will come upon him, but the desire of the just will be granted.
Proverbs 10:25 As a whirlwind passes, so the wicked will not remain, but the just is like an everlasting foundation.
Proverbs 10:26 As vinegar to the teeth, and smoke to the eyes, so is the lazy person to those who sent him.
Proverbs 10:27 The fear of the Lord prolongs days, but the years of the wicked will be shortened.
Proverbs 10:28 The hope of the just is joy, but the hope of the wicked will perish.
Proverbs 10:29 The way of the Lord is strength to the upright, and fear to those who do evil.
Proverbs 10:30 The just will never be moved, but the wicked will not inhabit the land.
Proverbs 10:31 The mouth of the just produces wisdom, but the tongue of the wicked will perish.

Proverbs 11:3 The integrity of the upright guides them, but the crookedness of the treacherous destroys them.
Proverbs 11:4 Wealth does not help when God’s anger comes, but justice will save from death.
Proverbs 11:5 The justice of the blameless keeps his way straight, but the wicked will fall.
Proverbs 11:6 The righteousness of the upright will deliver them, but the wicked will be caught in their own desires.
Proverbs 11:7 When the wicked dies, his hope dies, and the expectation of wealth comes to nothing.
Proverbs 11:8 The righteous are delivered from trouble, but the wicked take the righteous’ place.
Proverbs 11:9 With his mouth, a hypocrite destroys his neighbor, but the righteous are delivered by knowledge.
Proverbs 11:10 When the righteous prosper, the city rejoices, and when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.
Proverbs 11:11 A city prospers when the righteous bless it, but the wicked destroy it by their words.
Proverbs 11:12 Those who despise their neighbors are fools, but those with understanding hold their tongues.
Proverbs 11:13 A gossip reveals secrets, but a trustworthy person keeps a confidence.

Proverbs 11:19 He who is righteous has life, and he who pursues evil seeks his own death.

Proverbs 11:21 Assuredly, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the just shall be saved.
Proverbs 11:22 As a gold ring in a pig's snout, so is a beautiful woman who lacks good judgment.
Proverbs 11:23 The desire of the righteous is only good, but the expectation of the wicked will be wrath.
Proverbs 11:24 There are those who give freely, and become more wealthy. Others withhold what they should give, and become impoverished.
Proverbs 11:25 A generous person will be blessed, and he who waters will also be watered.
Proverbs 11:26 People curse those who hoard grain, but blessings are on the head of the one who sells it.
Proverbs 11:27 He who seeks good will find favor, but evil comes to him who searches for it.
Proverbs 11:28 He who trusts in his wealth will fall, but the righteous will flourish like green leaves.
Proverbs 11:29 He who brings trouble on his household will inherit the wind, and the fool will be the servant of the wise.
Proverbs 11:30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he who wins souls is wise.
Proverbs 11:31 If the righteous will be rewarded on earth, how much more the wicked and the sinner?

Proverbs 15:18 An angry man stirs up strife, but one who is patient settles quarrels.

Proverbs 15:20 A wise son makes a father happy, but a foolish man despises his mother.
Proverbs 15:21 Folly is joy to a fool, but a man of understanding directs his steps.
Proverbs 15:22 Without counsel, thoughts are disappointed, but in a multitude of counselors they are established.
Proverbs 15:23 A word fitly spoken at the proper time, is like apples of gold in settings of silver.
Proverbs 15:24 He who is corrected by the wise profits more than he who is praised by a fool.
Proverbs 15:25 As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to those who sent him, refreshing the soul of his masters.
Proverbs 15:26 Like one who takes off a garment in cold weather, like vinegar upon soda, is he that sings songs to a heavy heart.
Proverbs 15:27 If your enemy hungers, feed him. If he thirsts, give him to drink. For by doing this, you will heap coals of fire upon his head.
Proverbs 15:28 A wicked man will fall into evils, but the just hopes in his death.
Proverbs 15:29 Wisdom rests in the heart of the wise, but in the midst of fools it makes itself known.
Proverbs 15:30 Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin makes the peoples miserable.
Proverbs 15:31 The path of righteousness is the way of life, so that you can follow glory.

Proverbs 16:2 Man may believe his own actions are pure, but God assesses his spirit.

Proverbs 16:9 A man makes plans, but God directs his steps.
Proverbs 16:10 The king's decisions are divinely inspired; his words, when he judges, are right.

Proverbs 16:12 Kings should hate wicked actions, for it is justice that secures a throne.
Proverbs 16:13 Righteous speech pleases kings, and they love those who speak what is right.
Proverbs 16:14 A king's anger is a messenger of death, but a wise man can calm it.
Proverbs 16:15 When a king smiles, it is life. His favor is like a refreshing late rain.
Proverbs 16:16 It is better to gain wisdom than gold, and to have prudence more than silver.
Proverbs 16:17 The person who fears God turns away from evil. Whoever is careful with their path protects their soul.

Proverbs 16:19 It is better to be humble with the meek than to divide spoils with the proud.
Proverbs 16:20 The one who understands a teaching prospers, and happy is the one who trusts in the Lord.
Proverbs 16:21 The wise in heart is called intelligent, and the one with a gentle tongue wins favor.
Proverbs 16:22 Wisdom is a fountain of life to the wise, but the correction of fools is folly.
Proverbs 16:23 The heart of the wise teaches their mouth, and it adds grace to their lips.
Proverbs 16:24 Pleasant words are like a honeycomb: sweetness to the soul and health to the bones.
Proverbs 16:25 There is a way that seems right to a person, but its end leads to death.
Proverbs 16:26 A working person labors for themselves, because their need compels them.
Proverbs 16:27 A wicked man digs up evil, and on his lips is a scorching fire.
Proverbs 16:28 A dishonest man stirs up conflict, and a gossip separates friends.
Proverbs 16:29 A violent man deceives his neighbor and leads him on a path that isn't good.
Proverbs 16:30 The one who winks with his eyes plans deceit, and one who purses his lips performs evil.
Proverbs 16:31 Gray hair is a crown of glory; it is found in a life of righteousness.
Proverbs 16:32 The patient person is better than the warrior, and the one who controls his temper is greater than a city conqueror.
Proverbs 16:33 The lot is cast into the lap, but all its decision is of the Lord.
Proverbs 17:1 It is better to eat a dry crust of bread in joy, than to have a house filled with sacrificial feasts, but also with strife.
